[{'created': '2013-02-21 17:16:33.000000000', 'message': "heat api : don't store whole request in ec2Credentials context

The ec2token middleware currently dumps the whole request into the
request context when using AWS Auth, when all we really want are
the credentials (accesskey/signature)

fixes bug 1072917

Change-Id: I8fb0d4d7ada29d7d19c702a7da1251384166c246
"}]
commit_message:
heat api : don't store whole request in ec2Credentials context

The ec2token middleware currently dumps the whole request into the
request context when using AWS Auth, when all we really want are
the credentials (accesskey/signature)

fixes bug 1072917

Change-Id: I8fb0d4d7ada29d7d19c702a7da1251384166c246

commit_message:
Do not tag development releases "dev"

Do not tag development releases "dev", as it conflicts with our common
versioning code. Fixes bug 1131622.

Change-Id: I33ab25de1d1509c79d11f1919239798663b0cd22

messages:
[{'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-02-20 23:21:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I'm just catching up on all the RPC stuff happening lately and this one really seemed like we were heading down the wrong path

I was cc-ed on a thread with 19 emails discussing the two approaches in great detail. This thread should have been on the mailing list. Posted here so the (incredibly useful) discussion is archived for us all to refer to: http://markmc.fedorapeople.org/amqp-dup-msg/threads.html

Ray's summary makes the most sense to me: http://markmc.fedorapeople.org/amqp-dup-msg/msg00003.html

 My feelings are that we should proceed with the code review as provided by Kei in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/20567/.  Here are my reasons:

 * The change is limited to AMQP based implementations, Kombu and Qpid.
 * The change makes use of an existing msg_id already being passed in RPC calls.
 * It does add a _msg_id_nc to non-Call type RPCs, but that should not add a lot of overhead.
 * The duplicate ID checking itself does not add a lot of overhead.
 * The code is backward and forward compatible.
 * It could be removed in the future without resulting failures (forward and backward compatible)

Finally, the commit message in Ib0260a0c62e3d312d2e3448a125bed64d861319e is pretty appalling. Given the amount of discussion that went on about this, I can't understand why the commit message would just tersely describe the "what" and not the "why". Not even a reference to the bug being fixed.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-02-20 23:23:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-20 23:16:30.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Implement replay detection."

This reverts Ib0260a0c62e3d312d2e3448a125bed64d861319e (commit a603678)

The issue we're trying to fix here is bug #1107064 - when using mirrored
queues with AMQP, acks can be lost while a master is failing over to a
slace causing the new slave to re-send messages which had previously
been acked.

The "replay detection" code applies to more than just amqp and also has
the appearance of a security measure (e.g. the use of the term 'nonce')
when clearly it serves no security purpose until we actually have
message signing.

Revert the "replay detection" approach in favour of the more targetted
amqp bugfix.

Change-Id: I8b8d15835c8b4c85cd388f5df08b60ff4c74e38d
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Implement replay detection."

This reverts Ib0260a0c62e3d312d2e3448a125bed64d861319e (commit a603678)

The issue we're trying to fix here is bug #1107064 - when using mirrored
queues with AMQP, acks can be lost while a master is failing over to a
slace causing the new slave to re-send messages which had previously
been acked.

The "replay detection" code applies to more than just amqp and also has
the appearance of a security measure (e.g. the use of the term 'nonce')
when clearly it serves no security purpose until we actually have
message signing.

Revert the "replay detection" approach in favour of the more targetted
amqp bugfix.

Change-Id: I8b8d15835c8b4c85cd388f5df08b60ff4c74e38d

commit_message:
Provide a default api_extensions_path for nvp_plugin

The NVP plugin has several extensions within it's plugin directory. In order
to tell quantum-server to load this, api_extensions_path must be set in
quantum.conf. This is sort of painful because one needs to set this value.

Fixes bug 1131469

Change-Id: I8d124aa93f79dbeb8b2abac1c27765d5ebf449c2

'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-02-06 11:46:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

When doing a patch this big in nova we typically break it up per directory in a patch series so it's reviewable more easily. Can we do that?

Typically it would be:
1. fix hacking.py
2-N. fixes per directory
N+1. enforce T302

Also are the __init__.py changes required for this to function? They seem orthoginal."}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-02-06 16:27:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Even if it is possible to move out some parts of the patch, If we calculate the average patch acceptance interval and the rate of marge conflicts it will takes more than a month.

It is easier for everyone, if we had to rebase our other patches only once, because of the T302.

Comparing it to the nova big patches and source base, it can be considered as medium size patch.

We have circular import issues, which makes more difficult to spit this.

We also have * import issues. Some modules in the stress folder are outside of the tree.

If I do not do the __init__ thing I need to import json and xml with aliases, and it didn't looked well.

We should remove the xml and json folders, we should name the modules with _json.py and _xml.py, we do not need to name differently the classes in the rest client. The module name can tell it alone.

I can do this change in this patch as well.

As you can see, most changes are just code moves.

I agree, the hacking py modification, not the nicest, but working. And hopefully we will see similar changes in the nova's version."}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-02-11 12:21:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-11 13:58:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Works for me

I got the hint I am importing class instead of a module and it is not OK.

After I fixed that, the hacking.py Arbitrary Code execution feature
blocked my change.

Looked like I do not have any other choice than fixing the hacking.py.
Let's see why it is compiling and executing all of our code, and codes
even outside the tree.

The hacking.py using it for relative import check and for
module import check.
But it didn't worked.

Let's try to fix it..

First I got several additional error. I stated to fixing them.
Then I realized my checking is not fully correct. I have fixed it.
I got lot more issues.

I would recommend at least disabling these inspection based things...

Work in Progress...

It supposed to be 40 line change...

I am waiting for recommendations.

Check the pep8 logs, I hope it is working.

commit_message:
Temporary remove the inspection based import tests

* We have too many module import issue to enable it now
* It was not fully functional
* Until the aboves are solved, it is better to not do inspection

Change-Id: I5b06609f8ee2c7a3fcc1755fa492942e55635109

commit_message:
quantum, l3-agent: kill quantum-ns-metadata-proxy when stop

quantum l3-agent spanws quantum-ns-metadata-proxy. So they needs
to be killed when l3-agent is stopped.
And make the logic to kill dnsmaq robust at the same time.

Change-Id: Ib145b305254ab5b97f6b0edca36e07aabbdf5046

commit_message:
IBM Tivoli Storage Manager backup service

Implement a backup service for IBM Tivoli Storage Manager (TSM).
Backup service is a wrapper for TSM command line. The backup
service performs an image backup of the underlying block
device.

Change-Id: Icfd20b3ba3dbb03e677cb122e2c4b75b9f5d99e4
implements: blueprint volume-backup-ibm-tsm

[{'created': '2013-02-22 00:07:39.000000000', 'message': "Fix baremetal migration skipping.

The `have_mysql` function would only check for 'openstack_ci_test' and
not 'openstack_baremetal_test' yet was being used for the
baremetal-migration tests.

This resulted in tests to run that should have been skipped.

The solution is to have the test classes to define their configuraiton
requirements and then to pass these into the backend checking code
explicitly.

Change-Id: I436b5cfe4cace04e7bcccc2bed75b34948fe0272
(cherry picked from commit 1c5518badd5a74fecb7cf8b89d37926a5eeac7ab)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix baremetal migration skipping.

The `have_mysql` function would only check for 'openstack_ci_test' and
not 'openstack_baremetal_test' yet was being used for the
baremetal-migration tests.

This resulted in tests to run that should have been skipped.

The solution is to have the test classes to define their configuraiton
requirements and then to pass these into the backend checking code
explicitly.

Change-Id: I436b5cfe4cace04e7bcccc2bed75b34948fe0272
(cherry picked from commit 1c5518badd5a74fecb7cf8b89d37926a5eeac7ab)

commit_message:
Support different publisher interval

Changes the agent manager to poll based on pipeline configuration, to
support different interval requirement from different publishers.

This patch clean up the test case for agent managers. It makes the changes
a bit bigger, however, it's not so easy to seprate this cleanup patch
with different interval part.

For bp publisher-counters-frequency

Change-Id: I3c1163e37de6a17261d2c570843845696ebff58f
Signed-off-by: Yunhong, Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>

commit_message:
Run alternatives pip -> pip-python

Checks to see if python-pip is installed and installs
an alternatives link at /usr/bin/pip

Change-Id: I858ac2597d3cacc79144a8b345faf6a2f7dee26e

commit_message:
setup.py assumes current working directory has .git

cinder folks seem to have hit this bug (1125416). We
should try and find the correct parent directory before
we run the git commands.

Change-Id: I8147e98fe4a119560567b0d5eea1e7a960b4f613

[{'created': '2013-02-21 22:12:14.000000000', 'message': "Fix baremetal migration skipping.

The `have_mysql` function would only check for 'openstack_ci_test' and
not 'openstack_baremetal_test' yet was being used for the
baremetal-migration tests.

This resulted in tests to run that should have been skipped.

The solution is to have the test classes to define their configuraiton
requirements and then to pass these into the backend checking code
explicitly.

Change-Id: I436b5cfe4cace04e7bcccc2bed75b34948fe0272
"}]
commit_message:
Fix baremetal migration skipping.

The `have_mysql` function would only check for 'openstack_ci_test' and
not 'openstack_baremetal_test' yet was being used for the
baremetal-migration tests.

This resulted in tests to run that should have been skipped.

The solution is to have the test classes to define their configuraiton
requirements and then to pass these into the backend checking code
explicitly.

Change-Id: I436b5cfe4cace04e7bcccc2bed75b34948fe0272

commit_message:
Adding sysstat monitoring

You can add sysstat logging on the devstack run.
In CI environemnt, sometimes VM creation, Volume creation or
Python unit testing timeouts. It is valuable to monitor
sysstat for investigate the issues.

- How to enable sysstat ( Default is off )
enable_service sysstat

- This commit adds two env variables.
SYSSTAT_FILE : sysstat log file
SYSSTAT_DURATION : duration of sysstat monitoring

Change-Id: I65efb574ef141e6e78c69218f4327df59b3258e2

commit_message:
Remove function redefinitions

A number of tests have never been run due to another function having
the same name. Duplicate names have been changed and additionally
pyflakes check will now fail in such situations.

Also fix ovs ethernet driver test which was incorrect.

Change-Id: Icd93528395e65a24194a6ec5dfb8025a820d29b5

commit_message:
Set backdoor port to a random port.

This commit enables the eventlet backdoor on a random port
for each service. For tempest coverage runs this allows the
coverage extension to connect to other services to enable
coverage reporting.

Change-Id: I1a2e9e9a8d14982276fd9683591563d4b5a65be8

[{'account_id': 475, 'date': '2013-02-21 22:15:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I have a fix that addresses this as well https://review.openstack.org/#/c/22619/

One difference is that, `_have_mysql` is also erroneously passing in the default `user` and `passwd` as well.

I had not realized that the new baremetal refactoring directly used
the rest of our tests, which means the skip calls were no longer
correct. Allow for our environmental overrides to take an optional
database name so for baremetal we'll actually test for the existance
of the bm database.

Corrent the skip logic to force the env variables to "true", and not
allow empty string as success.

Change-Id: Iba291daad61b30501bb4acfe646ccf1d10937539
'}]
commit_message:
fix skip logic for baremetal

I had not realized that the new baremetal refactoring directly used
the rest of our tests, which means the skip calls were no longer
correct. Allow for our environmental overrides to take an optional
database name so for baremetal we'll actually test for the existance
of the bm database.

Corrent the skip logic to force the env variables to "true", and not
allow empty string as success.

Change-Id: Iba291daad61b30501bb4acfe646ccf1d10937539

[{'created': '2013-02-21 22:15:12.000000000', 'message': 'Fix id_to_dn for creating objects

Only do the lookup if the scope is not ONELEVEL
For ONELEVEL, there is no point in paying the price of the lookup.

If the object is not found for scoped queries, return the top level
DN so the object can be created.

Bug 1131265

Change-Id: I1ca41bf87c3bdea30fbdf607b19192f37dd0bfd6
'}]
commit_message:
Fix id_to_dn for creating objects

Only do the lookup if the scope is not ONELEVEL
For ONELEVEL, there is no point in paying the price of the lookup.

If the object is not found for scoped queries, return the top level
DN so the object can be created.

Bug 1131265

Change-Id: I1ca41bf87c3bdea30fbdf607b19192f37dd0bfd6

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-21 22:03:07.000000000', 'message': 'Flush tokens on instance delete

Force console auth service to flush all tokens
associated with an instance when it is deleted.
This will fix bug 1125378, where the console for
the wrong instance can be connected to via the
console if the correct circumstances occur. This
change also adds a call to validate the token
when it is used. This check will ensure that all
tokens are valid for their target instances.
Tokens can become scrambled when a compute node is
restarted, because the virt driver may not
assign ports in the same way.

Change-Id: I0d83ec6c4dbfef1af912a200ee15f8052f72da96
fixes: bug 1125378
(cherry picked from commit 3b0f4cf6bea33e6ee1893f6e872d968b0c309f88)
'}]
commit_message:
Flush tokens on instance delete

Force console auth service to flush all tokens
associated with an instance when it is deleted.
This will fix bug 1125378, where the console for
the wrong instance can be connected to via the
console if the correct circumstances occur. This
change also adds a call to validate the token
when it is used. This check will ensure that all
tokens are valid for their target instances.
Tokens can become scrambled when a compute node is
restarted, because the virt driver may not
assign ports in the same way.

Change-Id: I0d83ec6c4dbfef1af912a200ee15f8052f72da96
fixes: bug 1125378
(cherry picked from commit 3b0f4cf6bea33e6ee1893f6e872d968b0c309f88)

commit_message:
Fix id_to_dn for creating objects

Only do the lookup if the scope is not ONELEVEL
For ONELEVEL, there is no point in paying the price of the lookup.

If the object is not found for scoped queries, return the top level
DN so the object can be created.

Bug 1131265

Change-Id: I1ca41bf87c3bdea30fbdf607b19192f37dd0bfd6

[{'created': '2013-02-19 15:43:15.000000000', 'message': 'Report name resolution errors properly

Errors in name resolution have been logged previously with the url path
rather than the hostname. That resulted in incorrect errors like:

InvalidEndpoint: Error finding address for
/v1/images/detail?is_public=none&limit=20: [Errno -2]
Name or service not known

rather than one mentioning hostname itself. This patch changes the log
message to fit the situation.

Change-Id: I1eecbcb22d41b1341c214937b9cbfd046fd301a0
'}, {'created': '2013-02-19 17:23:05.000000000', 'message': 'Report name resolution errors properly

commit_message:
Report name resolution errors properly

Errors in name resolution have been logged previously with the url path
rather than the hostname. That resulted in incorrect errors like:

InvalidEndpoint: Error finding address for
/v1/images/detail?is_public=none&limit=20: [Errno -2]
Name or service not known

rather than one mentioning hostname itself. This patch changes the log
message to fit the situation.

Change-Id: I1eecbcb22d41b1341c214937b9cbfd046fd301a0

[{'account_id': 5678, 'date': '2013-02-16 00:14:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This is one way to fix bug 1125378.

Another way would be to associate tokens with instance IDs in the consoleauth service, and then remove all tokens associated with that instance when it is deleted.

I'm open to suggestions here."}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-02-18 10:11:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

vnc passwords offer no meaningful level of security - they are trivially brute force cracked.  The core issue described in that bug is that the VNC auth token Nova generates can still be used even after the VM it was created for is deleted. The obvious answer to that is to not honour the auth token after the VM is deleted."}, {'account_id': 1525, 'date': '2013-02-19 02:08:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I agree with Daniel."}, {'account_id': 5678, 'date': '2013-02-19 22:56:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-20 00:13:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

'}, {'account_id': 6896, 'date': '2013-02-20 11:04:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I agree with the reviewers and the right way forward is to flush the token(s) on instance delete and also on compute startup (since libvirt state may not persist to start the instance on the same port).

However, it should be noted that while VNC passwords (8 characters) can be cracked, for this context it's not such a bad solution for the following reasons.

1. The brute force has to complete within the TTL of the token which is 300s by default. The password space is 2^32 assuming hexadecimals only.

2. The instance that can be subverted is always a new instance, so the secret being shared is eliminated.

Again, I'm not advocating for vnc passwords, just wanted to note that it's not too bad a solution for the context."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-02-20 12:36:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

The bug is real, go into the nova-api logs and you can see a stack trace when interacting with nova-console-auth'}, {'account_id': 5678, 'date': '2013-02-20 14:11:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

It looks like the console auth service is not running (at least there is no log for it). Perhaps this call should only be made if VNC is enabled.'}, {'account_id': 5678, 'date': '2013-02-20 14:56:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 5678, 'date': '2013-02-20 14:58:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Call to delete_tokens_for_instance is moved to the compute service. This is to prevent the call from being made if VNC is disabled. The previous error occurred because a call to consoleauth was timing out, as that service doesn't run when vnc is disabled (I think)."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-20 15:48:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

We're going to need to check if CONF.spice.enabled also, as it uses consoleauth as well.  I may be wrong and if I am I'll remove my -1.

Otherwise it looks good."}, {'account_id': 5678, 'date': '2013-02-20 16:42:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Oops, forgot about spice. So I should change it to CONF.vnc_enabled or CONC.spice_enabled. Will do.'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-02-20 16:43:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Why not just unconditionally delete the tokens regardless of whether VNC or SPICE are enabled - it won't hurt will it ?"}, {'account_id': 5678, 'date': '2013-02-20 16:45:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

No, it wouldn't hurt. But if the consoleauth service is not enabled, there will be a timeout in this call. I added this check to prevent it from making a call to consoleauth when consoleauth isn't running. That is what caused the build errors in earlier builds. Is there a better way?"}, {'account_id': 5678, 'date': '2013-02-20 21:10:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-20 22:32:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-15 23:20:15.000000000', 'message': 'require password for novnc access

Enables password protection for vnc consoles. This is to avoid
a defect where users can connect to the console of the wrong
instance. This change requires the user to type in the uuid
of the instance they are trying to connect to. This prevents
the situation from occuring. This functionality can be enabled
by setting the vnc_require_instance_uuid_as_password in nova.conf

DocImpact

commit_message:
Flush tokens on instance delete

Force console auth service to flush all tokens
associated with an instance when it is deleted.
This will fix bug 1125378, where the console for
the wrong instance can be connected to via the
console if the correct circumstances occur. This
change also adds a call to validate the token
when it is used. This check will ensure that all
tokens are valid for their target instances.
Tokens can become scrambled when a compute node is
restarted, because the virt driver may not
assign ports in the same way.

Change-Id: I0d83ec6c4dbfef1af912a200ee15f8052f72da96
fixes: bug 1125378

commit_message:
Experimental branch for RAX commandline framework

* This currently does NOT run (needs to be hooked into Tempest config)
* This a proof of concept of how our group handled testing
  command line tools
* Imported basic test framework
* Imported commandline infrastructure
* Imported logging infrastructure
* Imported basic smoke tests

Change-Id: Ie325a33ec6f78446940de2333c5a156fd44560fc

This patch includes fixes for:

 * kombu: Fix lack of reconnect when using mirrored queues
 * zmq: support rpc envelopes
 * zmq: Fix IPC direct topic routing.

Change-Id: I3e494d0c1b72ed19ab4f590c5d5496a9b202633c
'}]
commit_message:
Sync rpc from oslo-incubator.

This patch includes fixes for:

 * kombu: Fix lack of reconnect when using mirrored queues
 * zmq: support rpc envelopes
 * zmq: Fix IPC direct topic routing.

Change-Id: I3e494d0c1b72ed19ab4f590c5d5496a9b202633c

commit_message:
Add 'host' parameter to wadl of the api v2/{tenant_id}/servers

For the api v2/{tenant_id}/servers, the wadl is
    api-ref/src/wadls/compute-api/src/os-compute-2.wadl, no change.
Put 'host' into the parameter list which is in
    api-ref/src/wadls/compute-api/src/common.ent

Story 130902
Epic 129324

Change-Id: I81250e0c5c6820cf9fb9dfa1c043c668c9e1da2b

commit_message:
Add snapshot methods to fakes.py

Modified Snapshots unit tests to use them
Removed logging from unit tests
The methods will also be used by the sample tests
Fixes bug 1130313

Change-Id: Id6c9c809952acefe302432bdfc345378730f0243

[{'created': '2013-02-21 18:57:10.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Fix nova-compute start when missing ip.

If nova-compute is restarted when an instance has no ip address
the libvirt/vif:_get_configuration method will throw an index
error. Check for existance of an ip before attempting to retrieve
one. Includes failing test.

Fixes bug 1131330

Change-Id: Id383544b44e64205fc3b4f850d0d11ad2ebd5da7
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Fix nova-compute start when missing ip.

If nova-compute is restarted when an instance has no ip address
the libvirt/vif:_get_configuration method will throw an index
error. Check for existance of an ip before attempting to retrieve
one. Includes failing test.

Fixes bug 1131330

Change-Id: Id383544b44e64205fc3b4f850d0d11ad2ebd5da7

'}, {'account_id': 642, 'date': '2013-02-20 06:55:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Well that's just silly"}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-02-20 12:16:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

These are good fixes, but can we do them *without* refactoring the upgrade function in the numbered migrations themselves? If anything is even slightly different between the new and old version of that, it makes it unfixable in the field. Touching migration files needs to be done with great care, and not at all if possible.

The code will all get rolled up by h-1 into a single migration anyway."}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2013-02-20 16:27:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Touching migration files needs to be done with great care, and not at all if possible.

Agreed that migrations need particular care, but these refactorings are pretty straight-forward: we're just pulling duplicated table definitions into a single place.

I'd think two core-devs spot checking those few lines + snake-walk tests that actually work now should be more than sufficient.

Second, I think there's an even greater risk in keeping around crufty migrations b/c it's common for people adding new migrations to copy-pasta from what's already there. 

This leads to a perpetuation of ugly, error-prone conventions causing us future headaches. I don't think it's a coincidence that in addition to 135 and 144 being broken, we had a string of consecutively broken migrations (146, 147 and 148).

> The code will all get rolled up by h-1 into a single migration anyway.

True, but someone has to manually port these migrations into the 'release-migration'; and from my experience, this is easier when working with better, DRYer code."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-02-20 16:50:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

there is completely gratuitous renaming of variables in these refactorings, which means I'm still -1. 

If you want to land the fixes minimally as one patch, then land the refactorings one at a time in a series, I'm ok with that approach. But I don't want them all mixed together. But in that case each refactoring (extract method, variable rename) needs to come as a seperate patch so it's super clear that it only changes one thing.

Eyeballs get tricked all the time, I've seen it happen a lot this week."}, {'account_id': 642, 'date': '2013-02-20 17:26:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Sean: And I'm still a +2. Isn't refactoring a primary use case for having unit tests?"}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-02-20 18:14:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I like the changes here but I agree with Sean, I would prefer this patch to be split up, especially so late in the development cycle.  Especially since this patch has a few distinct components to it.'}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2013-02-21 18:59:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Abandoned

WIP'}]

commit_message:
Make migration 146 actually delete rows.

In the downgrade portion of migration 146, it constructed the `delete`
statement, but never executed it; this patch adds the `execute` call.

Migration Test Harness Fixes/Cleanups:

* Fix test_migrations so snake-walk actually works (downgrade target
  version needs to be n-1 NOT same number)
* Adds `_post_downgrade_#` hook
* Renaming `_prerun_#` to `_pre_upgrade_#` to match `_post_downgrade_#`
* Remove unused `_have_mysql` function

Individual Migation Cleanups:

* 135: `drop` accepts column name not column object
* 144: drop index didn't update table metadata

Change-Id: I91e8ffa5b8d279e2a6e77941fb8d8d96c4094ee6

[{'created': '2013-02-18 23:39:01.000000000', 'message': "Avoid duplicate aggregate_hosts in migration 147.

The `upgrade` of 147 didn't check for existing aggregate_hosts before
inserting, which could lead to duplicate causing subsequent
rollback/roll-forward actions to fail.

The fix is to check for existing aggregate_hosts before inserting a new
record.

Additional cleansup:

* DRY up metadata and table setup
* Remove unecessary LOG statement
* Use `fetchall` instead of list-comprehension

Change-Id: I882c00b655a0a632b243e2a7842d4789207f2873
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid duplicate aggregate_hosts in migration 147.

The `upgrade` of 147 didn't check for existing aggregate_hosts before
inserting, which could lead to duplicate causing subsequent
rollback/roll-forward actions to fail.

The fix is to check for existing aggregate_hosts before inserting a new
record.

Additional cleansup:

* DRY up metadata and table setup
* Remove unecessary LOG statement
* Use `fetchall` instead of list-comprehension

Change-Id: I882c00b655a0a632b243e2a7842d4789207f2873

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-19 00:00:18.000000000', 'message': 'Fix dependency order in migration 148.

The downgrade of 148 was broken because instance_actions_events has a FK
dependency on instance_actions but was attempted to be deleted first,
which caused the sqlalchemy to complain.

The fix is to reorder the table deletes in the downgrade.

Additional cleanups:

* Make imports more similar to other migraiton scripts
* Remove unecessary logging
* Removed broken/unecessary exception handling

Change-Id: I12e30c47e3a5112795e56957eb539f691e8ef1bc
'}]
commit_message:
Fix dependency order in migration 148.

The downgrade of 148 was broken because instance_actions_events has a FK
dependency on instance_actions but was attempted to be deleted first,
which caused the sqlalchemy to complain.

The fix is to reorder the table deletes in the downgrade.

Additional cleanups:

* Make imports more similar to other migraiton scripts
* Remove unecessary logging
* Removed broken/unecessary exception handling

Change-Id: I12e30c47e3a5112795e56957eb539f691e8ef1bc

commit_message:
Add migration 20 - drop images.location

The image location data has been migrated out of this column, so it
is no longer useful. This migration simply drops it.

Related to bp multiple-image-locations

Change-Id: I5985c7ef41fceeb3d23063c7e9e76b3b9271ffa2

commit_message:
Add migration 19 - move image location data

Migration 19 moves image location data from images.location to
the new image_locations table. The sqlalchemy db driver has been
updated to look at this new table, but the complexity of multiple
locations is not yet exposed to the reset of the system.

Related to bp multiple-image-locations

Change-Id: I6c4c684f522d9b41b9930e7f79a4e6fb3e3f5c39

commit_message:
Periodic image.exists event generation

Adds a script which can be run periodically to generate an image.exists
    for each image which was active at any point during the past audit
    period. Two type of images are considered as having existed during
    the given audit period. First are active images that were created
    before or during the audit period. Second are images that were
    active but were deleted during the audit period. To determine if
    and image was or is active, we select based on location having been
    set and whether created_at/deleted_at are in range.

Partially implements: bp:glance-notifications-deux

Change-Id: Ic53ccb4c1c806db6eb22143bc717f01fc3e08763

commit_message:
Close file descriptors when executing sub-processes

Pass close_fds=True to subprocess.Popen(), as is currently done in
nova.utils.execute().

Fixes bug #1130735

Change-Id: Iec21873d7ef3957847f3b7365fadd613ccf1349d

commit_message:
Fix various exception paths

Fixes bug 1130723

Some bugs were introduced in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/20514/
this patch fixes the discovered errors. It also removes volume_id
parameters from error messages.

Change-Id: I9ff75482fe2bc13dbb65e7d666035a13a19d5c98

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-21 15:30:18.000000000', 'message': 'Fix aggregates exercise

Fixes bug 1131244

aggregates.sh was making assumptions on the working directory. Thus it
failed, if the current working directory is not devstack. This pathch
makes the sourcing to use the full path for openrc.

Change-Id: I10c83c88112ead97b43873e1034b0e76e4f889f4
'}]
commit_message:
Fix aggregates exercise

Fixes bug 1131244

aggregates.sh was making assumptions on the working directory. Thus it
failed, if the current working directory is not devstack. This pathch
makes the sourcing to use the full path for openrc.

Change-Id: I10c83c88112ead97b43873e1034b0e76e4f889f4

commit_message:
Fix create_userrc.sh private key hang

tools/create_userrc.sh hangs in a couple of mv commands now that
private keys are created with mode 400.  mv is prompting to
override the permissions, so let's just -f it all.

Change-Id: I8fbb24da6582edcff741653ffdf8bf683b79851a

commit_message:
Handle error in test_create_get_delete_service

Better handle create_service raising an exception in
test_create_get_delete_service. If create_service raises an
exception the test now no longer attempts to delete the service.

Fixes bug 1060358

Change-Id: Ie2fb9ee1260bea75397cc6f5ab3e12ad82fd451d

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-21 16:14:26.000000000', 'message': 'heat tests : fix run_tests.sh pep checks

run_tests.sh parses tox.ini, which has been changed removing the
pep8 version, so remove this test and specify the version in
test-requires.  This allows the pep tests to run via run_tests.sh
again, a subsequent patch can reinstate the version check based
on the test-requires version

fixes bug 1131251

Change-Id: Ib24f588cbe81ded768376c138d9d89f5bb311185
'}]
commit_message:
heat tests : fix run_tests.sh pep checks

run_tests.sh parses tox.ini, which has been changed removing the
pep8 version, so remove this test and specify the version in
test-requires.  This allows the pep tests to run via run_tests.sh
again, a subsequent patch can reinstate the version check based
on the test-requires version

fixes bug 1131251

Change-Id: Ib24f588cbe81ded768376c138d9d89f5bb311185

[{'created': '2013-02-21 16:00:54.000000000', 'message': 'heat tests : fix run_tests.sh pep checks

run_tests.sh parses tox.ini, which has been changed removing the
pep8 version, so remove this test and specify the version in
test-requires.  This allows the pep tests to run via run_tests.sh
again, a subsequent patch can reinstate the version check based
on the test-requires version

fixes bug 1131251

Change-Id: Ib24f588cbe81ded768376c138d9d89f5bb311185
'}]
commit_message:
heat tests : fix run_tests.sh pep checks

run_tests.sh parses tox.ini, which has been changed removing the
pep8 version, so remove this test and specify the version in
test-requires.  This allows the pep tests to run via run_tests.sh
again, a subsequent patch can reinstate the version check based
on the test-requires version

fixes bug 1131251

Change-Id: Ib24f588cbe81ded768376c138d9d89f5bb311185

commit_message:
Bind HOST_IP to PublicIP instead of localhost to ensure proper endpoint registration

* Devstack registers endpoints in keystone to host ip, instead of localhost
* We also need to 'export' the SERVICE_HOST settings, so test.conf is set up correctly
* using a simpler command as suggested by hub_cap to extract default iface

fixes bug: 1115352

Change-Id: I6aa7440c06bc4da595f3abf8ac50163d95af76d1

Thanks for the backport

stable/folsom is entering a temporary freeze before the 2012.2.3 release on Jan 31. Since state synchronization is notoriously fragile and the triggers list in the bug report (e.g. virsh suspend) are probably just things most users should avoid doing, I think we should defer this until after the release.'}, {'account_id': 6642, 'date': '2013-01-29 18:11:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Mark,
a libvirt commit related to this (https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=892791) uncovered many more issues with state tracking internal to libvirt:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=894085
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=896225

and perhaps more notoriously
https://www.redhat.com/archives/libvir-list/2013-January/msg01049.html

As you say, state tracking is a bit fragile, and certainly underlying libvirt bugs don't help. In light of this, folsom should be conservative, and the commit here helps it do the right thing. Without it, stable/folsom has the *wrong* policy: kill off VMs if unsure.

Can you please reconsider? 
Thanks"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-01-29 21:00:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-23 18:09:21.000000000', 'message': 'Fix state sync logic related to the PAUSED VM state

A VM may get into the paused state not only because the user request
via API calls, but also due to (temporary) external instrumentations.
Before the virt layer can reliably report the reason, we simply ignore
the state discrepancy. In many cases, the VM state will go back to
running after the external instrumentation is done.

Fix bug 1097806.

Change-Id: I8edef45d60fa79d6ddebf7d0438042a7b3986b55
(cherry picked from commit f7fbdeb5672bae7d3bffd6fa76de1ce81fc132bf)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix state sync logic related to the PAUSED VM state

A VM may get into the paused state not only because the user request
via API calls, but also due to (temporary) external instrumentations.
Before the virt layer can reliably report the reason, we simply ignore
the state discrepancy. In many cases, the VM state will go back to
running after the external instrumentation is done.

Fix bug 1097806.

Change-Id: I8edef45d60fa79d6ddebf7d0438042a7b3986b55
(cherry picked from commit f7fbdeb5672bae7d3bffd6fa76de1ce81fc132bf)

commit_message:
Fixed cinder-backup start errors seen with devstack

Changes:
- Added cinder-backup to scripts in setup.py
- Added service_name to backup manager __init__
- Switched backup manager to using oslo.config
- Modified cinder-backup to use ProcessLauncher

Fixes bug: 1131147

Change-Id: I9b02d64def4ee892e9cfde4b4bcd50e5f9f9b707

[{'created': '2013-02-21 10:13:27.000000000', 'message': 'Cinder devref doc cleanups

Way back when Cinder was inagurated as a separate project, the docs
directory from Nova was used as a seed for the one in the Cinder repo

This patch is simply cleaning out images and files which have no
relation to Cinder at all, and are at best extremely outdated when
applied to Nova.

Aside from the deletions which are mainly images, and files related
to the configuration of CloudPipe, there is one modification to
conf.py which simply removes a reference to a vmware doc that no
longer exists.

Change-Id: I2140035f98bd332f25d7dd7569993bcd960a869e
'}]
commit_message:
Cinder devref doc cleanups

Way back when Cinder was inagurated as a separate project, the docs
directory from Nova was used as a seed for the one in the Cinder repo

This patch is simply cleaning out images and files which have no
relation to Cinder at all, and are at best extremely outdated when
applied to Nova.

Aside from the deletions which are mainly images, and files related
to the configuration of CloudPipe, there is one modification to
conf.py which simply removes a reference to a vmware doc that no
longer exists.

Change-Id: I2140035f98bd332f25d7dd7569993bcd960a869e

commit_message:
heat : bump oslo-config version to fix import error

New oslo config patch causes services to fail to launch, with
"ImportError: No module named oslo.config", bumping to
oslo-config-2013.1b4.tar appears to fix the problem

fixes bug 1131135

Change-Id: I460564be19fc97bd54bb59c759c1148e7ead774b

commit_message:
Add an attribute to InstanceGroup and AutoScalingGroup to return the ips

This is so you can make a custom loadbalancer that can reference the
group's instance ip's.

fixes bug #1131025
Change-Id: I32d76d3627704ad503e2ec06bf0da39cf79f33d2

commit_message:
Update common to get new kombu serialization code

There are some changes in the serialization format for
messages sent with the kombu driver under some situations,
so bring in the new version of the driver to ensure we
can communicate with other components also using the new
format.

Change-Id: Iffd102cb780d13a40e93047a59917dc56c4d56ea
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

[{'created': '2013-02-19 14:04:08.000000000', 'message': 'Fix a bug in compute manager test case

Currently the compute manager test case use dictionary for instance,
however, this is not that correct because getattr() is not for dictionary.
As a result, the checking for OS-EXT-STS:vm_state in compute manager failed.

Signed-off-by: Yunhong, Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>

commit_message:
Fix a bug in compute manager test case

Currently the compute manager test case use dictionary for instance,
however, this is not that correct because getattr() is not for dictionary.
As a result, the checking for OS-EXT-STS:vm_state in compute manager failed.

Change-Id: I7ce6ea09055c29affc13ecdbbfbe3d8c43a0408f
Signed-off-by: Yunhong, Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-18 17:54:50.000000000', 'message': 'Pass query filter attributes to policy engine

With the v3 api, there will be cases when a cloud provider will want
to be able to protect apis by matching items in the query filter
string.  A classic case would be:

GET /users?domain_id="my domain'

The change augments the v3 controller protection wrapper with one
that will also pass in filter parameters. Since this filter list
also equates to the filter_by_attribute code that the subsequent
api call will make, the filterprotection wrapper passes the filter
list into the api call, allowing the code body to not have to
re-specify the same list.  This also has the consequency of fixing
all the missing filter_by_attribute statements in the current code
base.

Fixes Bug #1126048
Fixes Bug #1101240

Change-Id: Ibd9867f6eed585414671bbab774df95b8acdf6a5

commit_message:
Pass query filter attributes to policy engine

With the v3 api, there will be cases when a cloud provider will want
to be able to protect apis by matching items in the query filter
string.  A classic case would be:

GET /users?domain_id=mydomain

The change augments the v3 controller protection wrapper with one
that will also pass in filter parameters. Since this filter list
also equates to the filter_by_attribute code that the subsequent
api call will make, the filterprotection wrapper passes the filter
list into the api call, allowing the code body to not have to
re-specify the same list.  This also has the consequency of fixing
all the missing filter_by_attribute statements in the current code
base.

Some tests cannot yet be run due to dependency on completion of
v3/auth

Fixes Bug #1126048
Fixes Bug #1101240

Change-Id: Ibd9867f6eed585414671bbab774df95b8acdf6a5

- dev-heat-coverage : SKIPPED (non-voting)
"}, {'account_id': 2834, 'date': '2013-02-18 17:27:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Mark,

Many of our users are using heat on Folsom but want latest and greatest bug fixes and feature set.  Perhaps we need a Folsom branch for these users.

commit_message:
Use oslo-config-2013.1b3

The cfg API is now available via the oslo-config library, so switch to
it and remove the copied-and-pasted version.

Add the 2013.1b3 tarball to tools/pip-requires - this will be changed
to 'oslo-config>=2013.1' when oslo-config is published to pypi. This
will happen in time for grizzly final.

Add dependency_links to setup.py so that oslo-config can be installed
from the tarball URL specified in pip-requires.

Remove the 'deps = pep8==1.3.4' from tox.ini as it means all the other
deps get installed with easy_install which can't install oslo-config
from the URL.

Excluded code from oslo-incubator in the pep8 check.

Retain dummy cfg.py file until keystoneclient middleware has been
updated (I18c450174277c8e2d15ed93879da6cd92074c27a).

Change-Id: I4815aeb8a9341a31a250e920157f15ee15cfc5bc

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-17 01:59:58.000000000', 'message': "Fix instance can not be deleted after soft reboot

The reason is that:
1. soft reboot will wait for instance become to 'shutdown', and then start it
2. delete operation also wait for this, and then clean up the instance
3. if soft reboot found the instance become to 'shutdown' firstly, it will
start it immediately
4. then the delete operation will go to the _wait_for_destroy loop, and the
loop may be endless
5. when we delete the instance again, because the lock was hold by the delete
operation before, this one will wait the lock and don't implement actually.
So the domain id is checked during _wait_for_destroy loop, if it changed and
the instance is still running, we need to destroy it again.
If the domain is booted after _wait_for_destroy, it may result in
unfilter_instance failed because the nwfilter is in use, so doing the same
thing as above.

Fixes Bug #1111213

Change-Id: I98dc902dd86fa828f5821465c611953e08f9f637
"}]
commit_message:
Fix instance can not be deleted after soft reboot

The reason is that:
1. soft reboot will wait for instance become to 'shutdown', and then start it
2. delete operation also wait for this, and then clean up the instance
3. if soft reboot found the instance become to 'shutdown' firstly, it will
start it immediately
4. then the delete operation will go to the _wait_for_destroy loop, and the
loop may be endless
5. when we delete the instance again, because the lock was hold by the delete
operation before, this one will wait the lock and don't implement actually.
So the domain id is checked during _wait_for_destroy loop, if it changed and
the instance is still running, we need to destroy it again.
If the domain is booted after _wait_for_destroy, it may result in
unfilter_instance failed because the nwfilter is in use, so doing the same
thing as above.

Fixes Bug #1111213

Change-Id: I98dc902dd86fa828f5821465c611953e08f9f637

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-20 15:35:17.000000000', 'message': "Improve I/O performance for periodic tasks

Unfortunately, periodic tasks to update local resource and
driver status come with performance penalties, especially on LVM
image backend type.

This is because low level implementation relies 'vgs' command to
query LVM info, which itself has a I/O performance price and
extravagant use of local_gb_xxx query make things even worse.

This commit centralize such query in one single call
(volume_group_info) and reduce invocation times in periodic tasks
accordingly.

Partially resolves LP #1130697

Change-Id: I165f96dd3e4fdad770b8a9643f5a038d353312ff
"}]
commit_message:
Improve I/O performance for periodic tasks

Unfortunately, periodic tasks to update local resource and
driver status come with performance penalties, especially on LVM
image backend type.

This is because low level implementation relies 'vgs' command to
query LVM info, which itself has a I/O performance price and
extravagant use of local_gb_xxx query make things even worse.

This commit centralize such query in one single call
(volume_group_info) and reduce invocation times in periodic tasks
accordingly.

Partially resolves LP #1130697

Change-Id: I165f96dd3e4fdad770b8a9643f5a038d353312ff

Implement metadata options for snapshots

This patch implements metadata for snapshots as well as
the ability to update/delete that metadata.

Implements blueprint: update-snap-metadata

Change-Id: Iec2b7a51cdc3dffad41f24807067cc6c8e7d5135

commit_message:
Sync latest install_venv_common.py with olso

This patch syncs with oslo change set of
> c78b2ab Avoid using cfg in install_venv_common

So that oslo-config isn't needed to run install_venv

Change-Id: Ia7ee923a53e09c0c6a525294ec4a5dc9d31c3bed
Fixes: bug #1131009
Signed-off-by: Isaku Yamahata <yamahata@valinux.co.jp>

commit_message:
Fix instance directory path for lxc

Commit 12b8bd380e22a40e10e9d2758f5a0d594517de51 triggers a regression
when starting a STOPPED LXC instance. Instance referecne is needed to
correctly setup container rootfs path.

Change-Id: Id55b7f3a631e80a0da3f52c55784414105a61142

commit_message:
XenAPINFS: Create volume from image (generic)

Fixes bug 1130706

Related to blueprint xenapinfs-glance-integration

This patch enables users to use any images recognised by qemu-img to
create volumes on XenAPINFS.

Change-Id: I9dd8ec237309da82ec7f73db1acb48e5b7411c9e

commit_message:
Documentation fixups

These are mostly cosmetic fixes for irritating imperfections:
- "separated with commas" was duplicated, leave just one
- extra whitespace here and there, man pages are not PEP8, drop
- weird extra commas, drop
- Fedora logs to /var/log/messages
- "drive is has failed", drop "is"

Change-Id: I5ceba2e61b16db4855d76c92cbc83663b9b2a0da

commit_message:
(work-in-progress) Add a bootstrap element:

The boostrap element produces an image which,
when booted, contains a minimal running openstack,
for the purpose of bootstrapping a larger deployment.

What it does now:
  - boots vms using libvirt driver + nova-network
  - runs nova,glance,keystone,cinder,nova-network
  - adds a minimal set of users/roles/etc.

TODO:
  - reconfigure and test with baremetal driver
  - configure interfaces with static ips
  - use quantum instead of nova-network
  - break services into component elements
  - touch a file or otherwise indicate that
     first-boot scripts have completed successfully
  - documentation.

Change-Id: Ieeba863ab7304f96df77afa95ea54658c877a730

commit_message:
Move DB thread pooling to DB API.

The eventlet db_pool wrapping done in sqlalchemy is wrong.  It needs to
be around the whole DB API call.

Fixes bug 1128605

Syncs nova with the fix in oslo.  Moves nova to use the oslo version of
db/api.py to import the DB API implementation.

Renames configuration option sql_dbpool_enable to dbapi_use_tpool

NOTE: tpool will not work without a fix to eventlet for Threads + locking.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I6c75b6138d38d12261d133f2cb2f5e59c667f837

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-12 17:17:02.000000000', 'message': "Fix load balancer

The haproxy service wasn't being configured properly which resulted in
load balancer not working.

This was due to multiple causes:

* load balancer didn't use cfn-credentials
* cfn-hup was asking for the metadata of the nested stack and resource
(which isn't accessible from the Heat API)
* `systemctl reload haproxy.service` in hooks.conf always resulted in
a stopped service -- even with seemingly correct haproxy config file
* the policy check wasn't allowing access to nested stacks' metadata via
the describe_stack_resource API
* cfn-hup doesn't trigger events in the same order as they appear in the
hooks.conf file (which resulted in haproxy being restarted before its
configuration was updated)

The fixes here make the autoscaling template working again but the fix
is not complete. The changes here don't rely on cfntools update.

The following ought to be looked into separately:

* cfn-hup should trigger the events in the order they're written
* cfn-hup currently triggers the post.update events every time it's
called -- even when the metadata didn't change.
* related to that and the `systemctl reload` issue, haproxy gets
restarted every minute.

Change-Id: I8e89149740ee37a1357db450018892d1e3974bae
Signed-off-by: Tomas Sedovic <tomas@sedovic.cz>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix load balancer

The haproxy service wasn't being configured properly which resulted in
load balancer not working.

This was due to multiple causes:

* load balancer didn't use cfn-credentials
* cfn-hup was asking for the metadata of the nested stack and resource
(which isn't accessible from the Heat API)
* `systemctl reload haproxy.service` in hooks.conf always resulted in
a stopped service -- even with seemingly correct haproxy config file
* the policy check wasn't allowing access to nested stacks' metadata via
the describe_stack_resource API
* cfn-hup doesn't trigger events in the same order as they appear in the
hooks.conf file (which resulted in haproxy being restarted before its
configuration was updated)

The fixes here make the autoscaling template working again but the fix
is not complete. The changes here don't rely on cfntools update.

The following ought to be looked into separately:

* cfn-hup should trigger the events in the order they're written
* cfn-hup currently triggers the post.update events every time it's
called -- even when the metadata didn't change.
* related to that and the `systemctl reload` issue, haproxy gets
restarted every minute.

Change-Id: I8e89149740ee37a1357db450018892d1e3974bae
Signed-off-by: Tomas Sedovic <tomas@sedovic.cz>

commit_message:
Hyperv implementation of configuration strategies

Implements: blueprint configuration-strategies

configdrive will work independently, user will still
be able to control configdrive from server create
request or via force_config_drive on nova.conf

user will see different IDE DVD drive for ovfenv or
sysprep depending on the configuration strategy defined
in glance image configuration_strategy property

Change-Id: I6f729044f29276d4b7a40958cc0cab482cf9a015

commit_message:
Remove service startup scripts from os-svc-install:

Break upstart file generation out from os-svc-install into
a seperate utility, os-svc-upstart, since the mapping from
a source repo to services is one-to-many.

[{'created': '2013-01-22 13:57:36.000000000', 'message': 'Fix stale volume list for NetApp 7-mode ISCSI driver

While contacting filer through DFM in order to create volume from
snapshot, the operation may fail with an error "No entry in LUN
table for volume". Although the LUN representing the volume was
created on the filer, the LUN list was not refreshed in time, which
 caused an error. This fix handles this situation for creating
volume from snapshots.

Note that this fix adds the requirement that the driver host and
DFM machine should be reasonably time-synchronized.

Fixes bug 1095633

Change-Id: I77fff4c36a3af72d28f2d01988a6067919093718

commit_message:
Fix stale volume list for NetApp 7-mode ISCSI driver

While contacting filer through DFM in order to create volume from
snapshot, the operation may fail with an error "No entry in LUN
table for volume". Although the LUN representing the volume was
created on the filer, the LUN list was not refreshed in time, which
 caused an error. This fix handles this situation for creating
volume from snapshots.

Note that this fix adds the requirement that the driver host and
DFM machine should be reasonably time-synchronized.

Fixes bug 1095633

Change-Id: I77fff4c36a3af72d28f2d01988a6067919093718

cool stuff'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-02-19 09:56:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

It looks like this breaks filtering by removing the association between a VM NIC & the filter entirely.

This patch is mixing up several changes in one commit which is bad practice. It needs to be split up into separate pieces. 

 1. Only the refactoring of filter setup, with no functional changes
 2. Addition of support for multiple IP addresses in filters
 3. Support dynamic updating of filters

For further guidance see this wiki page

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages#Structural_split_of_changes

Also the bug reference line is wrong. It should include the word 'bug' eg

[{'created': '2013-02-18 01:08:42.000000000', 'message': 'Make add-fixed-ip update nwfilter wth in libvirt

 * libvirt < 1.0.1 does not allow dynamically updating filter
   parameters inside an interface block in the instance XML. To
   address this we move the nwfilter paramters from the instance
   XML to the per-instance base nwfilter.

 * Add inject_network_info to the libvirt driver  so that the
   add-fixed-ip call will trigger a refresh of the nwfilters.

Change-Id: I00eccf34b8f92fb1e26a72e4bddb47dd39c4558f
Fixes: #1124722

commit_message:
Make add-fixed-ip update nwfilter wth in libvirt

Add inject_network_info to the libvirt driver  so that the
add-fixed-ip call will trigger a refresh of the nwfilters.

Change-Id: I00eccf34b8f92fb1e26a72e4bddb47dd39c4558f
Fixes: bug #1124722

commit_message:
Add an extension to show image size.

Adds image size data that is returned from Glance into the API response.
This becomes really useful for users when they take a snapshot and want
to track the storage used by it.  Since this information is already
being pulled by Nova we should display it.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I8a2d4001c21bcc54cac1a2992034dfc9fbe39d7e

* Raise exception while item in uri is different then
* one passed in body during set server metadata for a key

Fixes LP bug #1114979

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-19 23:08:48.000000000', 'message': "Clean up logging from glance_http.py

Currently the logging in the glance_http module is overly
verbose and doesn't add any extra useful information. This
commit condenses the logging and makes it analogous to the
logging in rest_client.py

Fixes bug 1089765

Change-Id: Ifa7038de27d979a60ff36b6e32b2cbe85541c231
"}, {'created': '2013-02-20 14:03:58.000000000', 'message': "Clean up logging from glance_http.py

Currently the logging in the glance_http module is overly
verbose and doesn't add any extra useful information. This
commit condenses the logging and makes it analogous to the
logging in rest_client.py

Fixes bug 1089765

Change-Id: Ifa7038de27d979a60ff36b6e32b2cbe85541c231
"}]
commit_message:
Clean up logging from glance_http.py

Currently the logging in the glance_http module is overly
verbose and doesn't add any extra useful information. This
commit condenses the logging and makes it analogous to the
logging in rest_client.py

Fixes bug 1089765

Change-Id: Ifa7038de27d979a60ff36b6e32b2cbe85541c231

'}, {'account_id': 170, 'date': '2013-01-21 07:03:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(74 inline comments)

Hey Duncan, this is some great work. In addition to my inline comments I have some other comments/questions:

In regards to the tests, while I understand it's in-memory sqlite, I noticed they're having to hit the db multiple times. Have you considered using a model factory or fixtures like the other tests? With the current approach you're having to sometimes hit the db twice to create a volume and backup and then again twice to remove them after a test.

There also only appears to be a test of backups succeeding with the swift client, but no coverage for anything else. I've also noted some other missing coverage.

The current approach seems to suggest that swiftclient will be installed by default even if the backup service is not used. What about for those that use a different object store?"}, {'account_id': 4961, 'date': '2013-01-23 18:14:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 4961, 'date': '2013-01-23 18:17:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: (76 inline comments)

cinder/api/contrib/backups.py

I'm still curious to hear back from you about my concerns in patchset 12 in regards to your tests using in-memory sqlite. In the mean time while we're waiting for the additional swiftbackup tests, can you mark this review as work in progress?"}, {'account_id': 4961, 'date': '2013-01-31 18:45:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 4961, 'date': '2013-01-31 18:52:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: (6 inline comments)

Mike,
I've submitted patch set 15. It addresses the issues with the return values from the api 202 vs 200 and returning a summary as opposed to a detail on create. I've also updated the relevant api unit tests. I've added a db migration test for backups to test_migrations.

I'll take a look at your comments re in-memory sqlite and test coverage next week. I'm traveling for the next few days - I'll be back on Tuesday."}, {'account_id': 4961, 'date': '2013-01-31 18:58:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14: (7 inline comments)

A few little things I missed the first time around.

Also, why not go ahead an implement the general iscsi case of this similar to what we did with image->volume"}, {'account_id': 1207, 'date': '2013-02-04 18:40:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: (1 inline comment)

Replying to a comment'}, {'account_id': 4418, 'date': '2013-02-06 14:07:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

The backup and restore functions in the backup service should be path names and not file descriptors.
To enable generic solutions, the backup service should be responsible for opening/closing the device path."}, {'account_id': 1207, 'date': '2013-02-06 15:41:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

Reply to ronenkat:

As far as I can tell, a python file descriptor-like object is far more flexible, I can't see any advantage to using a path. Can you elaborate please?"}, {'account_id': 4418, 'date': '2013-02-06 18:50:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

Implementing a backup service using a backup software/tool can be based on creating a python wrapper for a command line tool that implements the backup/restore operations.
The backup/restore tool will then access the volume directly to execute the backup/restore.
In such case, you don't need the file object - just the path name."}, {'account_id': 170, 'date': '2013-02-08 08:48:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

Duncan and Francis, please disregard my comments on missing coverage for backup manager. I believe I've cleared things up on my end and see 100% coverage. thanks!"}, {'account_id': 1207, 'date': '2013-02-08 16:48:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-08 18:00:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 6528, 'date': '2013-02-13 22:53:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17:

Hi Duncan,

I got a question regarding this patch implementation. In the backup/manager.py file, I saw this code block,

backup_manager_opts = [

            cfg.StrOpt('backup_service',

                       default='cinder.backup.services.swift',

                       help='Service to use for backups.'),

]

Which means user can add the following cinder.conf entry,

backup_service=cinder.backup.services.s3 (by default it's swift)

then user should be able to switch the underneath backup service to S3 instead of swift (just an example)

Are you planning on providing that option? If so, then the db table should not hard code to swift related column names. Here is what I found in cinder db table,

mysql> desc backups;

+---------------------+--------------+------+-----+---------+----------------+

| Field               | Type         | Null | Key | Default | Extra          |

+---------------------+--------------+------+-----+---------+----------------+

| created_at          | datetime     | YES  |     | NULL    |                |

| updated_at          | datetime     | YES  |     | NULL    |                |

| deleted_at          | datetime     | YES  |     | NULL    |                |

| deleted             | tinyint(1)   | YES  |     | NULL    |                |

| id                  | int(11)      | NO   | PRI | NULL    | auto_increment |

| volume_id           | varchar(36)  | NO   | MUL | NULL    |                |

| user_id             | varchar(255) | YES  |     | NULL    |                |

| project_id          | varchar(255) | YES  |     | NULL    |                |

| host                | varchar(255) | YES  |     | NULL    |                |

| availability_zone   | varchar(255) | YES  |     | NULL    |                |

| display_name        | varchar(255) | YES  |     | NULL    |                |

| display_description | varchar(255) | YES  |     | NULL    |                |

| container           | varchar(255) | YES  |     | NULL    |                |

| status              | varchar(255) | YES  |     | NULL    |                |

| fail_reason         | varchar(255) | YES  |     | NULL    |                |

| swift_prefix        | varchar(255) | YES  |     | NULL    |                |

| size                | int(11)      | YES  |     | NULL    |                |

| object_count        | int(11)      | YES  |     | NULL    |                |

+---------------------+--------------+------+-----+---------+----------------+

18 rows in set (0.00 sec)

The swift_prefix and object_count columns are tied to swift. Other backup services such as S3 will not be able to reuse these columns. So far, I found all the usages of the swift_prefix column are in the swift.py file which can be replaced by other service module code such as S3.py. So is it possible to rename these two columns to some neutral strings such as back_svc_prefix, backup_chunk_count?

Thanks.

Dennis Qin"}, {'account_id': 1207, 'date': '2013-02-14 11:34:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17:

xiaohong-qin:

While I agree that the fields are not necessarily well named for other backup backends, I don't think that prematurely guessing what fields will be needed by other backends is necessarily useful either. I know of two different teams that are looking at extending this work for none-swift backends, and they can easily enough rename fields in a migrate script if they feel the need,"}, {'account_id': 4418, 'date': '2013-02-14 12:40:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I think we can update the database entries when we know more about backup providers and their requirements.
I am using "swift_prefix' for now to implement https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/volume-backup-ibm-tsm

While there is also an issue of orphan entries in the backup table, when the backup service stops and the backup does not reach *error* or *available* status.

The code looks good to be merged! will help with developing backup drivers! Good work.'}, {'account_id': 2759, 'date': '2013-02-15 12:14:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Two issues found so far: 1) the scheduling part doesn't seem right.  My concern is not all volume driver is able to do remote backup (backup service and volume service not on the same node).  The BackupManager's driver, which is some volume driver, is the one does actual backup job.  Therefore backing up one volume may actually have to go to the volume service node (e.g. LVM driver).  Randomly picking up one volume service (that's what chance/simple scheduler's schedule_create_backup) doesn't always work.
2) the modification to scheduler RPC API would bump version to 1.3."}, {'account_id': 5538, 'date': '2013-02-15 17:38:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: (8 inline comments)

Only reviewed one file so far: api/contrib/backups.py'}, {'account_id': 170, 'date': '2013-02-15 21:04:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Implement a basic backup-volume-to-swift service

Implements: blueprint volume-backups

This patch adds the new service, api and basic unit tests

commit_message:
Retry bw_usage_update() on innodb Deadlock

Adds a new decorator _retry_on_deadlock() to sqlalchemy api.  This patch
makes bw_usage_update() use it.

Fixes bug 1129622

Change-Id: I0293c62d2dd5ac036445bc639cabbd05ba016e83

commit_message:
Filter images by status and add visibility shared

This patch allows the user to filter images by status.
Whenever a user does an image list, the following are displayed:
(1) public images
(2) images owned by the user
(3) images whom the user is a member of and has set status to accepted
The user can change the status in (3) and also choose to display
the images the user has been requested to be a member of,
rejected to be a member of, or all images irrespective of the status
set by user

If visibility filter can be shared, public or private. Where shared
filter displays images which the user is a member of. This can be
used in conjunction with member_status

Related to bp glance-api-v2-image-sharing

Change-Id: I052c0947f9ad17ef1b14af0ad0f51b886afd0d7a

commit_message:
Keystone logs to a file:

By default, keystone logs to stdout.
When running it as a daemon, it should log to a file.

This change updates os-svc-install to create log
directories for openstack services under /var/log,
and updates keystone's start script to specify a log file.

Change-Id: Iea9e49272580d6f7c96f0ba604bd6f9549de2a80

commit_message:
Create an ssl directory for keystone service:

Keystone requires its ssl files to be in a writeable directory
in order to operate, because of the way it uses openssl.

This changes creates an /etc/keystone/ssl directory which
is writeable by the keystone user.

Change-Id: I1b91644ab342276651483e2b4d453e4ab1d278a6

commit_message:
pipeline: manager publish multiple counters

This makes the polling agent publish all counters in a row.
This fixes bug #1126990 and bug #1130475.

This moves the publisher() method to the *manager*. No agent/middleware
interacts with only one pipeline, this one an implementation mistake.

Change-Id: I45246849830066e39491f762b457adbdfa8d0e2e
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-19 13:02:50.000000000', 'message': 'Change in swift-drive-audit handling log rotation.

Change supports kern.log rotation in order to avoid loss
of significant information.

There is also backwards function added which allows
reading logs from the back to the front, speeding up the
execution.

Fixes Bug 1080682

Change-Id: I93436c405aff5625396514000cab774b66022dd0
'}, {'created': '2012-11-19 13:29:50.000000000', 'message': 'Change in swift-drive-audit handling log rotation.

Change supports kern.log rotation in order to avoid loss
of significant information.

There is also backwards function added which allows
reading logs from the back to the front, speeding up the
execution.

Fixes Bug 1080682

Change-Id: I93436c405aff5625396514000cab774b66022dd0
'}, {'created': '2013-01-29 18:57:19.000000000', 'message': 'Change in swift-drive-audit handling log rotation.

Change supports kern.log rotation in order to avoid loss
of significant information.

There is a year change functionality added as kern.log
does not keep record of year.

There is also backwards function added which allows
reading logs from the back to the front, speeding up the
execution along with the unit test for it

commit_message:
Change in swift-drive-audit handling log rotation.

Change supports kern.log rotation in order to avoid loss
of significant information.

There is a year change functionality added as kern.log
does not keep record of year.

There is also backwards function added which allows
reading logs from the back to the front, speeding up the
execution along with the unit test for it

Fixes Bug 1080682

Change-Id: I93436c405aff5625396514000cab774b66022dd0

commit_message:
Fix message envelope keys.

update.py from oslo-incubator broke the keys used in the rpc message
envelope.  This fixes it.

Change-Id: Idabd18720cad8c4469c5dc3ec1ffd20a3a39e897

'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2013-02-06 21:42:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 5292, 'date': '2013-02-11 12:48:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I believe that because of lack of versioning on api extensions that rather than adding functionality like show to an existing extension you're meant to create a new extension which extends the existing extension (awkward I know!). 

Also for new APIs we also want API doc samples. See here:

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/nova-api-samples"}, {'account_id': 4419, 'date': '2013-02-13 20:46:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16:

Hi Christopher,

Looking at: http://wiki.openstack.org/APIChangeGuidelines

I think the 'add a show' method falls under the good bullet point 'Adding a new response header'

also the 'id attribute' add falls under: 'Adding a property to a resource representation'

If I were to add additional tests for the nova-api-samples, do you think that'd give it more of a chance of your acceptance ?

Many Thanks :)"}, {'account_id': 5292, 'date': '2013-02-14 00:02:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

Hi Matiu,

I think you definitely need to add the nova-api-samples tests.

I don't have any concern with what the API looks like and the additions you have made, just where they are made. My understanding is that because of lack of versioning in nova extensions that it is necessary whenever adding new functionality to an extension to do that by creating a new extension which extends the existing extension rather than modifying the existing one. 

Unfortunately I think all of the discussion was on IRC (I can't seem to find an email thread about it). But this is done so a client can tell what functionality is available by looking at what extensions are available - ideally we'd have versioning so they could tell whether for your case the "show" method was available or not.

You can see an example of this here https://review.openstack.org/#/c/15491/ where I originally was going to just add some functionality (completely backwards compatible) to the networks extension but ended up having to create a new extension (but the API looked exactly the same from the client point of view).

Perhaps the thinking has changed since last year about this, but I think its worth checking on openstack-dev and with Vish.'}, {'account_id': 5174, 'date': '2013-02-15 17:32:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

totally agreed with chris on the api-sample thing"}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-02-19 13:30:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

needs samples changes for sure, I also don't know the urgency of an extension change here at this late of an hour."}, {'account_id': 4419, 'date': '2013-02-21 01:22:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Abandoned

Gonna redo and make it depend on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/21185/'}]

NOT READY YET.

Just want to get ideas on editing an existing (but un-released) api extension for now. Is there a better way ?

How does one address a service ?

I vote the main way should be just as an integer from it's DB id field. That's the only way to have a unique address right now.

 * Adds a 'show' method to api.openstack.compute.contrib.Services
 * Adds an 'id' attribute to the output of Services.index output - so
   that they can easily be referenced again later
 * Handles the possibility of a corrupt DB reporting multiple zones for
   a host in a more consistent way
 * Adds some clarification comments

Change-Id: I1accce90134e2237950727d3481689a594ca3dc8

     * Handles the possibility of a corrupt DB reporting multiple zones for
       a host in a more consistent way
     * Makes service_index tests use the DB - this makes the test less unit
       testy, but more thorough and use less code. It also allows for easier
       building of other tests on top of the setUp method

Implements: blueprint service-api-extension-upgrade1
Change-Id: I1accce90134e2237950727d3481689a594ca3dc8

commit_message:
Adds a show method to the service api

     * Adds a 'show' method to api.openstack.compute.contrib.Services
     * Adds an 'id' attribute to the output of Services.index output - so
       that they can easily be referenced again later
     * Adds an 'created_at' attribute to the output of Services.index output
     * Handles the possibility of a corrupt DB reporting multiple zones for
       a host in a more consistent way
     * Makes the tests for host_api related to services use the DB -
       this makes the test less unit testy, but more thorough and use
       less code. It also allows for easier building of other tests on
       top of the setUp method

Implements: blueprint service-api-extension-upgrade1
Change-Id: I1accce90134e2237950727d3481689a594ca3dc8

commit_message:
Uses tempdir module to create/delete xml file

The emc test in cinder is leaving behind its test generated
cinder_emc_config.xml file in /cinder/tests directory.  This
fix uses tempdir module to create the xml file and delete it
when tearDown is called.

Change-Id: I7fd1dda83a097d1122c58cd3ed723ed7f5de30d8
Fixes: bug #1130495

commit_message:
Moved cinder_emc_config.xml.sample to emc folder

Vendor unique driver files should not be placed in /cinder/etc/cinder, but
should stay with the vendors driver.  Moved cinder_emc_config.xml.sample
to cinder/volume/drivers/emc folder.

Change-Id: I92151abdf46a3597ea94284b6dfcf611153cab19
Fixes: bug #1130496

Move some context checking code from sqlalchemy

Move some context related code from sqlalchemy into nova/context.py
where it can be used outside of sqlalchemy.
