commit_message:
Don't s/oslo/base/ for files in the rpc lib.

This breaks some message envelope handling code and is not needed for
any of the source files in rpc/, so just avoid it.

Change-Id: I8519568be5102a5890ae5ed046d6fcebe9bbb198

subject: Revert "Fast serialization of RPC envelopes for Kombu"
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 159, 'name': 'Eric Windisch', 'email': 'ewindisch@docker.com', 'username': 'ewindisch'}, {'_account_id': 1030, 'name': 'Chris Behrens', 'email': 'cbehrens@codestud.com', 'username': 'cbehrens'}, {'_account_id': 1247, 'name': 'Mark McLoughlin', 'email': 'markmc@redhat.com', 'username': 'markmc'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-02-20 22:17:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-02-20 22:29:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-02-20 22:36:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

So after some further consideration ...

1) I can't think of any way that user data could result in a null byte in a message right now since all the user data is json serialized.  It still seems like it could be a problem in the future.

2) This has a significant impact for notifications.  With this change, consumers of notifications with a message envelope have to implement this same un-flattening of a message.  Since we don't own all the code that consumes this message, we have exposed the optimization / implementation detail to everyone who wants to consume notifications, which seems bad."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-02-20 22:42:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-02-20 22:42:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but commit message has changed.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-02-20 22:53:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-02-20 23:01:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

For reference, the original review was I64796265c7cc89a05406faabd8d7b253fe3b8acb

I buy Russell's concerns - the '\0' magic just has too much potential for borkage

Perhaps we can consider this again later, but it needs more consideration than a single day and a rush to get it in before grizzly-3. Before it gets merged again, I'd like to see e.g. russellb, comstud, Ray Pekowski and others chime in

Also, the performance justification for this is non-existent. From what was presented, I have no idea whether the improvement is measurable. Compare to Ray's awesome work in https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo/+spec/amqp-rpc-fast-reply-queue

Summary: let's back off from doing this in Grizzly. If it's really a good idea, I'm happy to revisit later"}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-02-20 23:02:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-02-20 23:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Approved

'}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2013-02-20 23:05:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

As Russell has already noted, there should be no problem with the null-character because the JSON serializer (where all user-generated data goes) already escapes all nulls.

Notifications are a concern, but it might be worth considering that anyone that implements a notification consumer either uses oslo-incubator or is expected to write some of their own code. The deserializer for these messages is not difficult to implement.  The ZeroMQ driver does this same flattening/unpacking, by the way, so consumers of *those* notifications would need to implement this deserialization method already.

Anyway, I certainly won't negative this. I do think this is significantly faster than the alternative, but I also agree that it is unknown if this optimization is generally important."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-21 00:04:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-20 22:08:54.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Fast serialization of RPC envelopes for Kombu"

This reverts commit 22c497097b0d0bd461be40a7a03290aa0b4179f2.

I'm not convinced that this isn't just a micro-optimization when
compared to the rest of the work that a given OpenStack service performs
as the result of these messages.

The implementation is also problematic.  It depends on using a '\0' byte
as a separator and assumes that '\0' will not exist anywhere else in the
message.  This seems to be asking for trouble.  I'm not convinced that
this can *never* happen and if it did, this code would break.  Further,
if a user could get a '\0' in a message directly with user-supplied
input, this could result in a security vulnerability.

Change-Id: Ib3163ca98f568bf9f789d4b64bcc6d72e0fcb459
'}, {'created': '2013-02-20 22:42:23.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Fast serialization of RPC envelopes for Kombu"

This reverts commit 22c497097b0d0bd461be40a7a03290aa0b4179f2.

I'm not convinced that this isn't just a micro-optimization when
compared to the rest of the work that a given OpenStack service performs
as the result of these messages.

The implementation is also problematic.  It depends on using a '\0' byte
as a separator and assumes that '\0' will not exist anywhere else in the
message.  This seems to be asking for trouble.  If future data could
ever have a '\0' in it, this will be broken.  Further, if a user could
get a '\0' in a message directly with user-supplied input, this could
result in a security vulnerability.

Lastly, this has a significant impact on consumers of notifications that
are outside of OpenStack code, which have been the primary use case of
notifications (Ceilometer is changing that to a degree).  I don't think
consumers of notifications should have to implement this deserialization
method.

Change-Id: Ib3163ca98f568bf9f789d4b64bcc6d72e0fcb459
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Fast serialization of RPC envelopes for Kombu"

This reverts commit 22c497097b0d0bd461be40a7a03290aa0b4179f2.

I'm not convinced that this isn't just a micro-optimization when
compared to the rest of the work that a given OpenStack service performs
as the result of these messages.

The implementation is also problematic.  It depends on using a '\0' byte
as a separator and assumes that '\0' will not exist anywhere else in the
message.  This seems to be asking for trouble.  If future data could
ever have a '\0' in it, this will be broken.  Further, if a user could
get a '\0' in a message directly with user-supplied input, this could
result in a security vulnerability.

Lastly, this has a significant impact on consumers of notifications that
are outside of OpenStack code, which have been the primary use case of
notifications (Ceilometer is changing that to a degree).  I don't think
consumers of notifications should have to implement this deserialization
method.

Change-Id: Ib3163ca98f568bf9f789d4b64bcc6d72e0fcb459

commit_message:
More gracefully handle TimeoutException in test

Sometimes although the test_killed_worker_recover test passes, the
cleanup of a forked child takes too long and a TimeoutException
occurs. This patch better handles the TimeoutException and
ensures the child process is killed.

Fixes bug #1128574

Change-Id: I39ea2fbb6c9cb95ad10b68bfa216686467951a93

commit_message:
ensure we run db tests in CI

CI had a set of environmental variables that refused to allow the
tests from failing gracefully. These seem to have gotten lost
along the way in refactoring.

Change-Id: Ib19b5d472c51ed72b8acf1571dd19f41474532c5

commit_message:
libvirt: fix volume walk of /dev/disk/by-path

If /dev/disk/by-path does not exist, then _get_iscsi_devices() will
raise an IndexError. Handle this case and return an empty list. This
fixes a test on OSX.

Fixes bug 1130841

Change-Id: Ibae2f1238feac9a10b8dc2b74886ea59edac0bcc

commit_message:
Removed duplicate spawn code in PowerVM driver

After introducing resize/migrate in PowerVM there was
some code that was duplicated after a rebase. The commit
removes the duplicate code. The functionality of
resize/migrate remains the same as introducted in
Change I72345626

Bug #1130680

Change-Id: I1fe3d8e1f2a19fd40a03c8c38d90c01711356b38

commit_message:
Remove race condition (in Networks)

Soft delete all duplicate rows with the same vlan except one with
the biggest value in `id` column.

Create UC on fields (vlan, deleted)

Replace Select then Insert -> Try to Insert.

Fix error in network_update method. We were able to update
vlan to duplicate.

Fix typo in description of method drop_old_duplicate_entries_from_table()

blueprint db-enforce-unique-keys

Change-Id: Ia1b58ab5a5e369a1939de0b5c2f89aee6fc2c40b

16:58 < devananda> lifeless: if you feel strongly on that, i'll reorder this patch to be last"}, {'account_id': 2889, 'date': '2013-02-14 14:36:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

As far as ideal solutions go, yes, I do agree with you.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-10 21:22:06.000000000', 'message': "Baremetal driver returns accurate list of instance

Add 'instance_name' to bm_nodes table so that baremetal driver is able
to return the names of all instances it beleives are still running.

Previously, baremetal.driver.list_instances was fetching all allocated
instances from baremetal database, then calling VirtAPI to get the
instance name. This would raise an InstanceNotFound exception for
deleted instances. This prevented ComputeManager from ever detecting
a running-but-deleted baremeal instance, and could leave baremetal
instances in an undeletable state.

Fixes bug 1096723.

Change-Id: Ifae532e8e70e97e48c589608cb3c7000bb6a7609

instance name. This would raise an InstanceNotFound exception for
deleted instances. This prevented ComputeManager from ever detecting
a running-but-deleted baremetal instance, and could leave baremetal
instances in an undeletable state.

Fixes bug 1096723.

Change-Id: Ifae532e8e70e97e48c589608cb3c7000bb6a7609

commit_message:
Baremetal driver returns accurate list of instance

Add 'instance_name' to bm_nodes table so that baremetal driver is able
to return the names of all instances it believes are still running.

Previously, baremetal.driver.list_instances was fetching all allocated
instances from baremetal database, then calling VirtAPI to get the
instance name. This would raise an InstanceNotFound exception for
deleted instances. This prevented ComputeManager from ever detecting
a running-but-deleted baremetal instance, and could leave baremetal
instances in an undeletable state.

Fixes bug 1096723.

Change-Id: Ifae532e8e70e97e48c589608cb3c7000bb6a7609

commit_message:
Identify baremetal nodes by UUID.

- add a new 'uuid' column to 'bm_nodes' table
- provide a new db/api method for accessing nodes by their uuid
- return this to Nova as the nodename / hypervisor_hostname

In this way, a baremetal node is uniquely identified to the user,
whether they use a per-compute baremetal db or global baremetal db.

It will also allow for an instance to be booted on a specific baremetal
node using a means akin to the current force-hosts (TBD in later patch).

Also, creates two new Exceptions to disambiguate between
InstanceNotFound and NodeNotFound / NodeNotFoundByUUID.

Change-Id: I81105a201588fdef31cffabdae260bb43017bcd1

subject: Improve performance of baremetal list_instances.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-10 01:38:05.000000000', 'message': 'Improve performance of baremetal list_instances.

This patch adds an "associated" option to the bm_node_get_all method.
Now, list_instances and get_available_nodes only fetch assocated and
unassociated nodes from the baremetal database, respectively.

Change-Id: Ib875d26d7b85a9dbf08c925a89802e2cd614e363
'}, {'created': '2013-02-10 21:22:07.000000000', 'message': 'Improve performance of baremetal list_instances.

This patch adds an "associated" option to the bm_node_get_all method.
Now, list_instances and get_available_nodes only fetch assocated and
unassociated nodes from the baremetal database, respectively.

Change-Id: Ib875d26d7b85a9dbf08c925a89802e2cd614e363
'}, {'created': '2013-02-13 02:42:35.000000000', 'message': 'Improve performance of baremetal list_instances.

This patch adds two new methods to baremetal/db/api:
 - bm_node_get_associated
 - bm_node_get_unassociated
which return a list of nodes either associated or not associated to a
Nova instance, as determined by the instance_uuid field, respectively.

Now, list_instances and get_available_nodes methods only fetch assocated
and unassociated nodes from the baremetal database, instead of fetching
all nodes.

Change-Id: Ib875d26d7b85a9dbf08c925a89802e2cd614e363
'}, {'created': '2013-02-13 05:31:34.000000000', 'message': 'Improve performance of baremetal list_instances.

commit_message:
Improve performance of baremetal list_instances.

This patch adds two new methods to baremetal/db/api:
 - bm_node_get_associated
 - bm_node_get_unassociated
which return a list of nodes either associated or not associated to a
Nova instance, as determined by the instance_uuid field, respectively.

Now, list_instances and get_available_nodes methods only fetch assocated
and unassociated nodes from the baremetal database, instead of fetching
all nodes.

Change-Id: Ib875d26d7b85a9dbf08c925a89802e2cd614e363

subject: Better error handling in baremetal spawn & destroy

commit_message:
Better error handling in baremetal spawn & destroy

Improve the exception handling in baremetal driver spawn and destroy.

Adds unit tests for destroy to check that bm_node is disassociated
from instance_uuid only when destroy succeeds, and is set to ERROR state
(but still associated) if any exception is not handled.

Change-Id: I75853210d4883b352da9876a682dbb7288689541

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-09 09:41:20.000000000', 'message': 'Wait for baremetal deploy inside driver.spawn

Previously, baremetal driver.spawn returned as soon as the
machine power turned on, but before the user-image was deployed to the
hardware node, and long before the node was available on the network.
This meant the nova instance was marked as ACTIVE before provisioning
had actually finished. If the deploy failed and the baremetal node was
set to an ERROR state, the nova instance could still be left as ACTIVE
and the user was never informed of the error.

This patch introduces a LoopingCall to monitor the deployment status in
the baremetal database. As the deployment is performed by
nova-baremetal-deploy-helper, the database record is updated. Once the
deployment is complete, driver.spawn() sets the baremetal node status
and the nova instance status is also set properly. If an error occurs
during the deployment, it is recorded in the baremetal database, and
an exception is raised within driver.spawn() allowing nova to
follow the normal cleanup and notify paths.

This also allows the baremetal PXE driver to delete cached image files
when a baremetal deployment fails.

Fixes bug 1088655.

Partially fixes bug 1096723.

DocImpact.

Change-Id: I4feefd462fd956c9780995ec8b05b13e78278c8b

commit_message:
Wait for baremetal deploy inside driver.spawn

Previously, baremetal driver.spawn returned as soon as the
machine power turned on, but before the user-image was deployed to the
hardware node, and long before the node was available on the network.
This meant the nova instance was marked as ACTIVE before provisioning
had actually finished. If the deploy failed and the baremetal node was
set to an ERROR state, the nova instance could still be left as ACTIVE
and the user was never informed of the error.

This patch introduces a LoopingCall to monitor the deployment status in
the baremetal database. As the deployment is performed by
nova-baremetal-deploy-helper, the database record is updated. Once the
deployment is complete, driver.spawn() sets the baremetal node status
and the nova instance status is also set properly. If an error occurs
during the deployment, an exception is raised within driver.spawn()
allowing nova to follow the normal cleanup and notify paths.

This also allows the baremetal PXE driver to delete cached image files
when a baremetal deployment fails.

Fixes bug 1088655.

Change-Id: I4feefd462fd956c9780995ec8b05b13e78278c8b

commit_message:
Modify-user features.

Grant, revoke, list user access.
Change user password and get single user.

Partially implements blueprint modify-users

Change-Id: I0001a7a9d1c527b88a1ed965f0f077c864e602cf

commit_message:
Doc libvirt_snapshot_compression option

fixes bug 1111091

libvirt_snapshot_compression -added in grizzly, enables compression
for qcow2 options in libvirt. This patch adds the option to the table.

Change-Id: Ie29ea1f8023c879bf1f6e2fc5bf77dcd1ec9fa61

Hi Yun, Yes, the reason for this is because there has not yet been a pypi package that has been created that has the security group functions in it. I had this patch rebased on top of this one (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/21920/) but I don't think that patch is going to get merged because it's not pulling the package from pypi so I did the rebase. If you have the python-quantumclient from master this error will not happen."}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-02-16 21:48:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-02-16 21:52:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-02-16 21:53:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Add Nova quantum security group proxy

Implements blueprint nova-quantum-security-group-proxy

Change-Id: I21d70f1dc8e61d6412d14e30ab2aa1a83a711de2

Hi Mark, 

I hope I addressed all your comments. I decided to move the security group api that belonged to nova and ec2 back to their original location in nova/api  as before. Regarding the removal of _format_security_group/_rule() I moved these to their driver classes. The reason why I did this is because this function is called from get() and in the quantum scenario the values quantum returns differ slightly from nova's. Pulling this into the security group driver allows me to remove an extra method in order to convert from quantum to nova just to be able to pass values into format_security_group/_rule() . Thanks for the review."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-02-19 08:18:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-15 19:31:59.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor nova security groups to allow to them to be more plugable

Change-Id: Ib183515a0418203c8bcc88176e3a1498d7333300
'}, {'created': '2013-02-15 22:25:50.000000000', 'message': 'Make nova security groups more plugable

This patch moves the nova security group code out of nova/compute/api.py
into nova/network/security_group. It also removes any query to the database
from security group api into the nova security group driver. This allows
security group drivers the ability to decouple themselves from storing
security group information in the nova_db.

Change-Id: Ib183515a0418203c8bcc88176e3a1498d7333300
'}, {'created': '2013-02-15 22:38:21.000000000', 'message': 'Make nova security groups more pluggable

security group information in the nova_db.

commit_message:
Make nova security groups more pluggable

This patch moves the nova security group code out of nova/compute/api.py
into nova/network/security_group. It also removes any query to the database
from security group api into the nova security group driver. This allows
security group drivers the ability to decouple themselves from storing
security group information in the nova_db.

Change-Id: Ib183515a0418203c8bcc88176e3a1498d7333300

commit_message:
Tweak GroupAntiAffinityFilter doc

fixes bug 1128587

Gary Kotton noted in the bug that multiple hints were being
specified in the commandline example for the GroupAntiAffinityFilter

This patch fixes this and adds a descriptive line about what the hint
is used for.

patch2 encloses group and server1 in the description in literal tags

patch3 fixes one of the literal tags

Change-Id: Ie15ea3deebd44e0caaf5a01d45cb90d5ed0a9d9e

commit_message:
Add HUAWEI volume driver in Cinder

This is an iSCSI driver.It supports HUAWEI OceanStor T and
Dorado series storage systems.The driver communicates with
storage systems based on SSH.

Implements: blueprint huawei-volume-driver
Change-Id: Ib3fd8ff636106e751789f6367a5b57bdaab316f4

commit_message:
Unignore log_format option

Allow log_format option to be settable by the operator,
as per configure-logging documentation. Thanks to Marcus Furlong.
Fixes LP: #1124716

Change-Id: If0c4e42ccbbd6bc3bde63620e9fd522a3c4e9efe
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

Update openstack.common

This changeset primnarily brings in the join_consumer_pool()
feature of the rpc library.

commit_message:
Refactor nwfilter parameters

* libvirt < 1.0.1 does not allow dynamically updating filter
  parameters inside an interface block of theinstance XML. To
  address this we move the nwfilter paramters from the instance
  XML to the per-instance base nwfilter.

Relates to bug #1124722

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-18 02:43:03.000000000', 'message': "Move DB thread pooling to DB API loader

Fixes bug 1128605

The dbpool code in sqlalchemy session is the wrong place to implement
thread pooling as it wraps each individual SQL call to run in its own
thread.  When combined with SQL server locking, all threads can be eaten
waiting on locks with none available to run a 'COMMIT'.

The correct place to do thread pooling is around each DB API call.

This patch removes dbpool from sqlalchemy and creates a common DB API
implmentation for all openstack projects which implement the following
configuration options:

db_backend: Full path to DB API backend module (or a known short name if
            a project chooses to implement a mapping)
dbapi_use_tpool: True or False whether to use thread pooling around all
                 DB API calls.

NOTE: Enabling thread pooling will be broken until this issue is
resolved in eventlet (or until we find a way to patch ourselves):

https://bitbucket.org/eventlet/eventlet/issue/137/use-of-threading-locks-causes-deadlock

Change-Id: Idf14563ea07cf8ccf2a77b3f53659d8528927fc7
"}, {'created': '2013-02-18 02:59:41.000000000', 'message': 'Move DB thread pooling to DB API loader

Fixes bug 1128605

The dbpool code in sqlalchemy session is the wrong place to implement
thread pooling as it wraps each individual SQL call to run in its own
thread.  When combined with SQL server locking, all threads can be eaten
waiting on locks with none available to run a 'COMMIT'.

The correct place to do thread pooling is around each DB API call.

This patch removes dbpool from sqlalchemy and creates a common DB API
loader for all openstack projects which implements the following
configuration options:

db_backend: Full path to DB API backend module (or a known short name if
            a project chooses to implement a mapping)
dbapi_use_tpool: True or False whether to use thread pooling around all
                 DB API calls.

Example usage for nova/db/api.py would be:

"""
from nova.openstack.common.db import api as db_api

_KNOWN_BACKENDS = {'sqlalchemy': 'nova.db.sqlalchemy.api'}

IMPL = db_api.DBAPI(known_backends=_KNOWN_BACKENDS)
"""

NOTE: Enabling thread pooling will be broken until this issue is
resolved in eventlet (or until we find a way to patch ourselves):

https://bitbucket.org/eventlet/eventlet/issue/137/use-of-threading-locks-causes-deadlock

Change-Id: Idf14563ea07cf8ccf2a77b3f53659d8528927fc7

commit_message:
Move DB thread pooling to DB API loader

Fixes bug 1128605

The dbpool code in sqlalchemy session is the wrong place to implement
thread pooling as it wraps each individual SQL call to run in its own
thread.  When combined with SQL server locking, all threads can be eaten
waiting on locks with none available to run a 'COMMIT'.

The correct place to do thread pooling is around each DB API call.

This patch removes dbpool from sqlalchemy and creates a common DB API
loader for all openstack projects which implements the following
configuration options:

db_backend: Full path to DB API backend module (or a known short name if
            a project chooses to implement a mapping)
dbapi_use_tpool: True or False whether to use thread pooling around all
                 DB API calls.

DB backend modules must implement a 'get_backend()' method.

Example usage for nova/db/api.py would be:

"""
from nova.openstack.common.db import api as db_api

_KNOWN_BACKENDS = {'sqlalchemy': 'nova.db.sqlalchemy.api'}

IMPL = db_api.DBAPI(backend_mapping=_KNOWN_BACKENDS)
"""

NOTE: Enabling thread pooling will be broken until this issue is
resolved in eventlet _OR_ until we modify our eventlet.monkey_patch()
calls to include 'thread=False':

https://bitbucket.org/eventlet/eventlet/issue/137/

Change-Id: Idf14563ea07cf8ccf2a77b3f53659d8528927fc7

commit_message:
Re-enable tests for bugs already marked as fixed

The following bugs are marked either fixed or fix committed in lp

1094142 Flavor Extra Specs should require admin privileges by default
1090320 Volume type extra specs update with empty body returns HTTP status 422
1072318 Incorrect ec2 error code (DescribeKeyPairs)
1051881 Failed Live Block Migration leaves with Inconsistent Instance Status
1080406 DisassociateAddress can cause Internal Server Error
1004564 ComputeFault while creating a snapshot with a really long name (>256 characters)

Let's try enabling them again

Change-Id: I8b31c495f41f42624392a1e7ecee64dbf6250c2d

commit_message:
Sync latest install_venv_common.py

Syncs:

c78b2ab Avoid using cfg in install_venv_common

So that people don't need oslo-config installed to run install_venv

Fixes bug 1130853

Change-Id: I9dfc8d8417455ff22a0d0e911c762983952c75ee

I think Kevin's comment is worth a -1, sorry.  getting close though."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2013-02-14 18:16:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

First, for the benefit of keeping history, it's best to keep conversation about a given review attached to the review itself.  (If you don't know how to make comments on a review, click on the "Review" button, fill in the message, then click "Publish Comments".)

Second, I'll point out that I did not -1 the patch; the temporary files stuff was just something that caught my eye at the last minute, and I don't want to hold up the patch if other reviewers don't see it as a problem.  (I'm sorry to say I miss a lot of things on reviews, partly because I end up doing a lot of themâ¦)

I am sorry that there are a lot of things that come up in reviews.  I'll freely admit that many of them are a bit too nit-picky.  Honestly, I think we have a tendency to go too far on that, and it does worry me that we might be snubbing good developers without meaning to.

Anyway, from my point of view, the temporary files thing should be addressed, and fixtures is a great way of doing that.  My primary thought on that is ensuring that the temporary files go away, even in the face of a test failure, to avoid filling up /tmp; but a second thought is making sure we take security into account.  I believe that is the last thing I need for a +2, but I can't presume to speak for the other reviewersâ¦'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-02-14 19:23:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

+2 from me after that update as well'}, {'account_id': 6540, 'date': '2013-02-18 16:20:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: (1 inline comment)

commit_message:
Add a volume driver in Nova for Scality SOFS

Scality SOFS is a network filesystem mounted with FUSE, with most
options given in a configuration file. Given a mount point and a SOFS
configuration file as driver options, the Scality volume driver mounts
SOFS, and then creates, accesses and deletes volumes as regular
(sparse) files on SOFS.

Change-Id: I84bf268e5a2c5c33b8706830e8067914fae44aed
Implements: blueprint scality-volume-driver

commit_message:
Fix rpc test

There's no test.TestingException in oslo.  This adds it and fixes the
RPC tests to use it properly.

Change-Id: I1398c634495912a649c967ee5d29daa1b2cae069

subject: Implement cloning generically when snapshots are required
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-19 08:57:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see http://wiki.openstack.org/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

- http://logs.openstack.org/22287/1/check/gate-cinder-pep8/2305 : FAILURE

- gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full : SKIPPED
- gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum : SKIPPED
"}, {'account_id': 4355, 'date': '2013-02-19 09:07:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This doesn't seem right.  Why should the user see a new snapshot and volume after cloning?  This seems like an RBD-specific issue, and should be handled in the driver.  The intermediate snapshot should be hidden from the user."}, {'account_id': 1107, 'date': '2013-02-19 09:42:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1107, 'date': '2013-02-19 09:45:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

There are a couple reasons this should be in the manager (and not the driver):

1) the snapshot must be visible to the user so they can delete it if they delete the cloned volume in the future
2) the drivers know nothing about the database, and should not need to

This isn't rbd-specific - the nexenta driver, for example, also has cloning that depends on the 'intermediate' snapshot still existing."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-19 11:11:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/22287/2/check/gate-cinder-pep8/2306 : SUCCESS

'}, {'account_id': 4355, 'date': '2013-02-19 11:38:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

The user should not need to know about the intermediate snapshot, and should definitely not need to manually delete it!  The snapshot should be created by the back-end, tracked by the back-end, and deleted by the back-end."}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2013-02-19 14:30:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I'm not sure why this needs to be something exposed via a flag?  We do in fact use an interim snapshot in a number of drivers for the clone but the drivers themselves make that decision.  

This does help with the clone across back-ends which maybe is your intent, but for that I'd propose using a field in the stats to indicate the requirement."}, {'account_id': 1107, 'date': '2013-02-20 07:17:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-20 08:06:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-19 08:47:16.000000000', 'message': "Implement cloning generically when snapshots are required

RBD and some other storage systems require snapshots to clone from,
and have clones that depend on the snapshot continuing to exist.

Add a driver method, cloning_requires_snapshot(), to express this
need. If this method returns True, the manager will create a snapshot
of the source volume and create a volume from that snapshot instead
of using the driver's create_cloned_volume() method. Add tests to make
sure this invariant is maintained.

Change-Id: Id68d0ab96a88b05405e2567716ac88cdb2fb709c
Signed-off-by: Josh Durgin <josh.durgin@inktank.com>
"}, {'created': '2013-02-19 09:42:18.000000000', 'message': "Implement cloning generically when snapshots are required

RBD and some other storage systems require snapshots to clone from,
and have clones that depend on the snapshot continuing to exist.
Without the intermediate snapshot being visible, the user cannot
delete it.

Add a driver method, cloning_requires_snapshot(), to express this
need. If this method returns True, the manager will create a snapshot
of the source volume and create a volume from that snapshot instead
of using the driver's create_cloned_volume() method. Add tests to make
sure this invariant is maintained.

Change-Id: Id68d0ab96a88b05405e2567716ac88cdb2fb709c
Signed-off-by: Josh Durgin <josh.durgin@inktank.com>
"}, {'created': '2013-02-20 07:17:05.000000000', 'message': 'Implement cloning generically when snapshots are required

RBD and some other storage systems require snapshots to clone from,
and have clones that depend on the snapshot continuing to exist after
the clone is complete. Without the intermediate snapshot being
visible, the user cannot delete it later.

Use a capability in get_volume_stats() to indicate whether a
persistent snapshot is required, and if it is, create a snapshot and a
volume from the snapshot, instead of using the create_cloned_volume()
driver method.

Change-Id: Id68d0ab96a88b05405e2567716ac88cdb2fb709c
Signed-off-by: Josh Durgin <josh.durgin@inktank.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Implement cloning generically when snapshots are required

RBD and some other storage systems require snapshots to clone from,
and have clones that depend on the snapshot continuing to exist after
the clone is complete. Without the intermediate snapshot being
visible, the user cannot delete it later.

Use a capability in get_volume_stats() to indicate whether a
persistent snapshot is required, and if it is, create a snapshot and a
volume from the snapshot, instead of using the create_cloned_volume()
driver method.

Change-Id: Id68d0ab96a88b05405e2567716ac88cdb2fb709c
Signed-off-by: Josh Durgin <josh.durgin@inktank.com>

commit_message:
Disable notifier tests

Temporarily disable the nova notifier tests so we can work on
decoupling the notifier from the rest of ceilometer to fix
the issue with oslo.config.

Change-Id: Ib5c33a37a8eed464a36724e9bb8af162af44fc5c
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

@Boris, can't make this a subclass without rewriting a very large chunk of the BaseMigrationTestCase. It references class variables, not class members, pretty heavily. Also, I do not want to inherit all the _pre_* and _check_* methods from the parent class... trying to subclass would mean making a virtual base class that both test classes derive from. Maybe something worth doing in Havana ;)"}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2013-02-15 04:40:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

Hmm probably you haven't seen but I splited it already. (so there is TestMigrationBaseCase(abstract class) and TestMigrations
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/20935/

There is no prerun in TestMigrationBaseCase (only work with engines and config loading and parsing)."}, {'account_id': 2889, 'date': '2013-02-15 18:09:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

@Boris,

I just looked at your changes. It's exactly as I said -- your derived class is no different and not reusable. Since baremetal has a different database, different migration and config file, etc, I would still need to duplicate the whole file.

A class derived from your BaseMigrationTestCase will need to not only override the class variables MIGRATE_FILE, etc, it will also need to override setUp; setUp refers to BaseMigrationTestCase many times rather than self.

The same is true for TestMigrations._walk_versions; this refers to its class variables directly, rather than via self, many times.

Also, my tests need to

  import nova.virt.baremetal.db.migration as migration

whereas the existing tests import "migration" as

  import nova.db.migration as migration

so again, that reference would need to change all over the code... and these are just a few examples.'}, {'account_id': 2889, 'date': '2013-02-15 18:10:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

Going to post a minor revision based on Mikal's comments on other patches -- changing (c) header to 2013."}, {'account_id': 2889, 'date': '2013-02-15 18:16:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 5652, 'date': '2013-02-15 18:42:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-08 00:52:31.000000000', 'message': "Add status and instance_uuid to bm_deployments

Add 'status' and 'instance_uuid' columns to bm_deployments.

This patch changes the behaviour of bm_deployments: they are no
longer deleted immediately after completion. Instead, a deployment is
marked as ACTIVE. Later, when an instance is deleted, the associated
deployment is also deleted.

In this way, an active baremetal instance can be verified by comparing
PXE/TFTP configuration with an active entry in bm_deployments. This will be
useful in identifying orphaned instances and zombie nodes
(to be done in a future patch).

Change-Id: Iad30b462d49c88fc19babed43a2fb8540b1fad30

"}, {'created': '2013-02-10 17:15:13.000000000', 'message': "Add status and instance_uuid to bm_deployments

Add 'status' and 'instance_uuid' columns and an index on 'bm_node_id'
to bm_deployments.

This patch changes the behaviour of bm_deployments: they are no
longer deleted immediately after completion. Instead, a deployment is
marked as ACTIVE. Later, when an instance is deleted, the associated
deployment is also deleted.

In this way, an active baremetal instance can be verified by comparing
PXE/TFTP configuration with an active entry in bm_deployments. This will be
useful in identifying orphaned instances and zombie nodes
(to be done in a future patch).

partially implements fix for bug 1096723

Change-Id: Iad30b462d49c88fc19babed43a2fb8540b1fad30
"}, {'created': '2013-02-13 02:42:34.000000000', 'message': 'Add better status to baremetal deployments.

This patch introduces a few new baremetal states, which are used to
track the deploy process. Now, nova-baremetal-deploy-helper updates the
bm_nodes record directly when it begins and finishes deploying an image
to that node.

The next patch will add a LoopingCall inside driver.spawn() to wait for
the deploy to complete.

Also, since there can not be >1 active deployment per node, there
is no need to have a separate table for storing them. This patch drops
the table bm_deployments and adds the important information it contained
to bm_nodes. Since the previous behavior was to mark a deployment as
deleted once it completed, there is no need to copy any data from
bm_deployments prior to dropping the table -- assuming that no active
deployments are in process when the migration is run.

partially implements fix for bug 1096723

Change-Id: Iad30b462d49c88fc19babed43a2fb8540b1fad30

commit_message:
Add better status to baremetal deployments.

This patch introduces a few new baremetal states, which are used to
track the deploy process. Now, nova-baremetal-deploy-helper updates the
bm_nodes record directly when it begins and finishes deploying an image
to that node.

The next patch will add a LoopingCall inside driver.spawn() to wait for
the deploy to complete.

Also, since there can not be >1 active deployment per node, there
is no need to have a separate table for storing them. This patch drops
the table bm_deployments and adds the important information it contained
to bm_nodes. Since the previous behavior was to mark a deployment as
deleted once it completed, there is no need to copy any data from
bm_deployments prior to dropping the table -- assuming that no active
deployments are in process when the migration is run.

Since this is the first migration for the baremetal database, it also
adds a new test class, TestBaremetalMigrations, and refactors the
test_migrations.py file to allow for multiple test classes.

partially implements fix for bug 1096723

Change-Id: Iad30b462d49c88fc19babed43a2fb8540b1fad30

commit_message:
Adding new common image properties

Revised schema and glance sphinx docs, renamed 'os_arch' to
'architecture' for backwards compatibility, renamed 'os_shortid'
to 'os_libosinfo_shortid'.

Partially implements blueprint glance-common-image-properties

Change-Id: I23d8ba82015f1f53bff65b4fa08463d905eeadd8

[{'created': '2013-02-20 15:53:39.000000000', 'message': "heat engine : Update stack dependencies during update

We need to update the stack dependencies each time we modify the
properties list, otherwise in the event of a failure, the resources
returned from the iterator methods don't match with those found via
getitem/contains (which is important for rollback)

blueprint update-rollback

Change-Id: Ia47f84291f50c33fc052b7b33fa0c1f9e8430ab4
"}, {'created': '2013-02-20 16:26:29.000000000', 'message': "heat engine : Update stack dependencies during update

We need to update the stack dependencies each time we modify the
resources list, otherwise in the event of a failure, the resources
returned from the iterator methods don't match with those found via
getitem/contains (which is important for rollback)

blueprint update-rollback

Change-Id: Ia47f84291f50c33fc052b7b33fa0c1f9e8430ab4
"}]
commit_message:
heat engine : Update stack dependencies during update

We need to update the stack dependencies each time we modify the
resources list, otherwise in the event of a failure, the resources
returned from the iterator methods don't match with those found via
getitem/contains (which is important for rollback)

blueprint update-rollback

Change-Id: Ia47f84291f50c33fc052b7b33fa0c1f9e8430ab4

When doing an update, we want to fail immediately, instead of
collecting the resource update errors and continuing.  This is
particularly important for update rollback, where we want to

blueprint update-rollback

Change-Id: I56133254036d8aac592dcf3cda2ca7928cc02fa9
'}]
commit_message:
heat engine : fail update immediately on resource update failure

When doing an update, we want to fail immediately, instead of
collecting the resource update errors and continuing.  This is
particularly important for update rollback, where we want to
declare failure ASAP to simplify and speed up the rollback

blueprint update-rollback

Change-Id: I56133254036d8aac592dcf3cda2ca7928cc02fa9

'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-02-09 00:42:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Sean,

There was, RPC wire couldn't serialize objects, only primitives.  The solution was to use to_primitive before sending an object over RPC.

The current version of this patch calls to_primitive on all nova.db.api return values that contain sqlalchemy objects, but it leaves datetime objects alone.  Datetime objects aren't converted because they are expected all over the place (and not using datetime was out of the scope of this BP).   This means we cannot fully get rid of using to_primitive for RPC, but now  RPC to_primitive will only have to convert datetime objects."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-02-09 04:16:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I like what you're trying to do here.  However, it is a little bit off-putting to construct the IMPL (backend) and then decorate individual functions after the fact.

What if you wrapped the IMPL object instead?  I think it might be a bit easier to read.

Something like:

class Primitizer(object):

  def __init__(self, backend):
     self.backend = backend

  def __getattr__(self, key):

     def to_primitive(*args, **kwargs):
        rv = getattr(self.backend, key)(*args, **kwargs)
        .... turn into primitive ...
        return primitive

backend = utils.LazyPluggable(...)
IMPL = Primitizer(backend)"}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-02-16 01:31:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-16 02:55:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
No sqlalchemy objects returned from nova.db.api

Have nova.db.api enforce no sqlalchemy objects returned.
This is done by wrapping all functions in IMPL with jsonutils.to_primitive.
This does not convert datetime objects.

Fix any remaining access as attribute issues.

Finishes main component of bp db-api-cleanup

Change-Id: Ia3e4f6c233e014024d35b1735d43d9bacc4e0c49

Hi Vish,
 

I see we've been looking at (at least partially) the same issue.  I have a patch in progress for oslo to fix to_primitive() so it can go deeper than 3 

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/21632/

That will allow the caller of to-primitive to say how deep they want to go.

There is a suggestion that we should at the same time change the default to say 5 (since 3 was somewhat aribtary and we now know there are some structures 4 deep).  


I'll push that anyway as its already nearly done - but in view of that I wondered if we want to have code in Nova to explicitly work around the limit in to_primitive - it feels a tad klutzy to me.

Phil"}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-02-12 10:22:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: No score

Sorry, that was meant to be a "0" overall and just a comment on whether to work around the depth limit in Nova or fix it in OSLO'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2013-02-12 17:15:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Fix handling of source_groups with no-db-compute.

The moving of data around in no-db-compute broke source groups. This
is a combination of a few errors. First, the instance_type data wasn't
being retrieved from system_metadata. Second, the instance_type data
was too deep in the heirarchy and being ignored. Finally, source
groups require a nw info call which causes a db access by
nova-compute.

Fixes bug 1122316

Change-Id: Iccb6e5d336c0b2c8ba41c41ab2e046fc9617835a

commit_message:
Add eventlet backdoor method for threads

Add a pt() method that prints stacktraces from all Threads.  This
provides more info than just pgt().

Change-Id: I85f76866cbae398b831bd1ce40d602ef84f43201

'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-02-12 18:16:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

I would prefer to wait until Ifc871f4fdbcd4a9a736170ceb4475f4f2cbe66bc lands.

Also hacking.py needs to be able to run some tests that only make sense in one project (such as no db compute).  So copying the code straight from nova won't work that well.

Also the N in the codes stands for Nova.   Lets change it to O for Oslo."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-02-12 23:27:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

yeh, should change N -> O, for OpenStack.

Also, I think we need to libraryize this so that we can do things like add custom nova rules.

My thinking is that the way we'd do that would be making this a library with an explicit function to register other functions, instead of the monkey patch introspection. Then every project would have a small front end that they could add their own custom rules explicitly that way.

Was going to take this on once things start calming down in the grizzly release, but you are welcome to have it as well."}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-02-17 07:49:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Good call. Actually, I'd like to take most of the things in most of the tools dirs that we have, like this, and flakes, etc. and make them into a library/util thing we can upload to pypi and just use instead of copy. I"}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-02-20 18:40:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-07 18:25:59.000000000', 'message': 'Prevent the unexpected with nova-manage network modify.

"nova-manage network modify" can misinterpret arguments if the user
provides values where they are unexpected, specifically the
--disassociate-project and --disassociate-host options. If the user
provides a project or hostname value for either of these values, it will
be interpreted as a positional argument and modify handler may behave as
if other options were provided (e.g. project or host).

This change handles the presence of a project or host option along with
--disassociate-project or --disassociate-host as an error, printing a
message and exiting immediately with an error code. While there are
other approaches (e.g. perform the disassociate modifications while
ignoring the others), preventing unexpected or inconsistent results by
doing nothing seems safest.

Change-Id: Iff7817fe3ed19a4ff330b4029f9c558d3b405e9b

This change handles the presence of a project or host option along with

Change-Id: Iff7817fe3ed19a4ff330b4029f9c558d3b405e9b

commit_message:
Prevent the unexpected with nova-manage network modify.

"nova-manage network modify" can misinterpret arguments if the user
provides values where they are unexpected, specifically the
--disassociate-project and --disassociate-host options. If the user
provides a project or hostname value for either of these values, it will
be interpreted as a positional argument and modify handler may behave as
if other options were provided (e.g. project or host).

This change handles the presence of a project or host option along with
--disassociate-project or --disassociate-host as an error, printing a
message and exiting immediately with an error code. While there are
other approaches (e.g. perform the disassociate modifications while
ignoring the others), preventing unexpected or inconsistent results by
doing nothing seems safest.

Change-Id: Iff7817fe3ed19a4ff330b4029f9c558d3b405e9b

commit_message:
rbd: implement get_volume_stats()

Report raw capacity because replication level may change, and the
cluster may be used by more than one service. If the command fails for
any reason, return unknown capacity.

Change-Id: If6871124301b51e4768ea64c4d8e5109e0804db8
Signed-off-by: Josh Durgin <josh.durgin@inktank.com>

Boto does not, by default, validate https ceritificates on endpoints. We
now provide a way to specify it in the heat configuration along side
is_secure. Heat deployers may also need to turn this off if boto ever

commit_message:
Add config for boto https_validate_certificates

Boto does not, by default, validate https ceritificates on endpoints. We
now provide a way to specify it in the heat configuration along side
is_secure. Heat deployers may also need to turn this off if boto ever
does make it default and they want to use self signed certs.

Fixes bug #1130345

Change-Id: I09b684dd28a8a57c6ce514d1df1e699e7c8b182e

commit_message:
Add LIO configuration for iSCSI initiators

LIO requires iSCSI initiator IQNs to be specified in an ACL to be
allowed to connect to the target. Currently this is only done for
the IQN of the initiator on the cinder-volume node.

This patch allows setting lio_initiator_iqns in cinder.conf to
provide access to other nodes.  (Remote Nova compute nodes.)

Change-Id: I7ddee542fcd3fba5b6f142ad15459c08cfedc9d2

commit_message:
support multiple IPs on an interface in libvirt

We now pass a list of IP addresses to
set_vif_host_backend_filter_config and add each address to the
filter parameters.

Relates to bug #1124722

Change-Id: Ie4c1eb1daaa06b5af6393a0ce2932c59bb5b4221

commit_message:
Sync rpc from oslo-incubator.

This includes the following changes:

 * use oslo.config directly
 * implementation of rpc-amqp-fast-reply-queue
 * simplifications to bin/nova-rpc-zmq-receiver
 * add new join_consumer_pool API call
 * a bug fix to ensure kombu messages get acked even when an exception
   occurs in the message callback

Change-Id: I813ce0ee7d5442d7b5b0f9d477949adabc83174e

commit_message:
readd update.sh to address bootstrapping issue

Provide an easy way to people to run the update script even
in a brand new oslo-incubator tree.

(fix spelling error)

Change-Id: I8c8f6e1d2d988ca0fffa79a7d8e9a67cf8311e7f

"}, {'created': '2013-02-20 15:24:19.000000000', 'message': "Allow exit code 21 for 'iscsiadm -m session'.

Updates the libvirt volume driver so that it properly handles

commit_message:
Allow exit code 21 for 'iscsiadm -m session'.

Updates the libvirt volume driver so that it properly handles
exit code 21 in the active session check. This fixes issues
in running the command on Fedora 17.

This behaviour was broken in 933365a (multipath libvirt iscsi).

Fixes LP Bug #1130718.

Change-Id: I80de4c09ba857d550734f9bd0dfc0c40bfd5036a

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-25 19:30:05.000000000', 'message': "Allow create_volume() to retry when exception happened

This patch enables create_volume() request to be rescheduled.
Volume manager will try reschedule the request when operation
failed, a scheduler_max_attempts config option is introduced
to set the maximum retry times.  Filter scheduler is updated
accordingly.

Changes:
1) volume RPC API create_volume() is updated with new parameters
to save original request information in case rescheduling is needed.
This bumps volume RPC API to 1.3.
2) implementation of create_volume() method in volume API is
refactored in order to distinguish if a request is allowed to
do reschedule (i.e. currently create volume from source volume
bypasses scheduler, not rescheduling is allowed).
3) add reschedule functionality in create_volume() of volume
manager so that it's able to send the request back to scheduler.

TODO:
  A retry filter should be added so that scheduler can skip those
  volume services that has been tried.

Change-Id: Ia46b5eb4dc033d73734b6aea82ada34ba5731075
"}, {'created': '2013-01-28 17:03:13.000000000', 'message': "Allow create_volume() to retry when exception happened

Due to the fact that certain volume back-ends cannot easily report
simple total_capacity_gb/free_capacity_gb for their internal
implementation complexity, it is critical to enable Cinder to
'retry' a create_volume request.
To achieve that, volume manager is updated so that when an exception
raises while calling back-end driver's create_volume() method, it can
send the request back to scheduler for rescheduling.  Scheduler (filter
scheduler only, simple and chance scheduler is not supported) is updated
as well so that it only retry scheduler_max_attempts times.  Also to
skip/rule out previously tried back-ends in next schedule, a RetryFilter
is added.

Changes:
1) volume RPC API create_volume() is updated with new parameters
to save original request information in case rescheduling is needed.
This bumps volume RPC API to 1.3.
2) implementation of create_volume() method in volume API is
refactored in order to distinguish if a request is allowed to
do reschedule (i.e. currently create volume from source volume
bypasses scheduler, not rescheduling is allowed).
3) add reschedule functionality in create_volume() of volume
manager so that it's able to send the request back to scheduler.
4) add schedule_max_attempts config option in scheduler/driver.py

Change-Id: Ia46b5eb4dc033d73734b6aea82ada34ba5731075
"}, {'created': '2013-01-29 08:56:55.000000000', 'message': "Allow create_volume() to retry when exception happened

Due to the fact that certain volume back-ends cannot easily report
simple total_capacity_gb/free_capacity_gb for their internal
implementation complexity, it is critical to enable Cinder to
'retry' a create_volume request.
To achieve that, volume manager is updated so that when an exception
raises while calling back-end driver's create_volume() method, it can
send the request back to scheduler for rescheduling.  Scheduler (filter
scheduler only, simple and chance scheduler is not supported) is updated
as well so that it only retry scheduler_max_attempts times.  Also to
skip/rule out previously tried back-ends in next schedule, a RetryFilter
is added.

Changes:
1) volume RPC API create_volume() is updated with new parameters
to save original request information in case rescheduling is needed.
This bumps volume RPC API to 1.3.
2) implementation of create_volume() method in volume API is
refactored in order to distinguish if a request is allowed to
do reschedule (i.e. currently create volume from source volume
bypasses scheduler, not rescheduling is allowed).
3) add reschedule functionality in create_volume() of volume
manager so that it's able to send the request back to scheduler.
4) add schedule_max_attempts config option in scheduler/driver.py

Change-Id: Ia46b5eb4dc033d73734b6aea82ada34ba5731075
"}, {'created': '2013-01-31 04:11:30.000000000', 'message': "Allow create_volume() to retry when exception happened

Due to the fact that certain volume back-ends cannot easily report
simple total_capacity_gb/free_capacity_gb for their internal
implementation complexity, scheduler is updated to let those back-ends
who report unclear capacity pass capacity filter, thus there is chance
create_volume() request would fail. In a more general case, when a
volume back-end failed to serve create_volume request for whatever reason
it'd be good that we have a mechanism to 'retry' the request.

So the idea is when volume manager catches the exception from
driver.create_volume() call, it checks if the request is allowed to be
rescheduled (requests that are not: clone volume and create volume from
snapshot while 'snapshot_same_host' option is true), it composes a new
request back to scheduler with additional information to mark this specific
back-end has been tried (so that scheduler may choose to skip this back-end
if needed).  Scheduler is (filter scheduler only, simple and chance
scheduler is not supported) is updated as well so that it only retry
scheduler_max_attempts times.  In order to skip/rule out previously tried
back-ends in next schedule task, a new RetryFilter is added.

Changes:
1) volume RPC API create_volume() is updated with new parameters
to save original request information in case rescheduling is needed.
This bumps volume RPC API to 1.3.

2) implementation of create_volume() method in volume API is
refactored in order to distinguish if a request is allowed to
do reschedule (i.e. currently create volume from source volume
bypasses scheduler, not rescheduling is allowed).

3) add reschedule functionality in create_volume() of volume

"}, {'created': '2013-01-31 05:34:30.000000000', 'message': "Allow create_volume() to retry when exception happened

Due to the fact that certain volume back-ends cannot easily report
simple total_capacity_gb/free_capacity_gb for their internal
implementation complexity, scheduler is updated to let those back-ends
who report unclear capacity pass capacity filter, thus there is chance
create_volume() request would fail. In a more general case, when a
volume back-end failed to serve create_volume request for whatever reason
it'd be good that we have a mechanism to 'retry' the request.

So the idea is when volume manager catches the exception from
driver.create_volume() call, it checks if the request is allowed to be
rescheduled (requests that are not: clone volume and create volume from
snapshot while 'snapshot_same_host' option is true), it composes a new
request back to scheduler with additional information to mark this specific
back-end has been tried (so that scheduler may choose to skip this back-end
if needed).  Scheduler is (filter scheduler only, simple and chance
scheduler is not supported) is updated as well so that it only retry
scheduler_max_attempts times.  In order to skip/rule out previously tried
back-ends in next schedule task, a new RetryFilter is added.

Changes:
1) volume RPC API create_volume() is updated with new parameters
to save original request information in case rescheduling is needed.
This bumps volume RPC API to 1.4.

2) implementation of create_volume() method in volume API is
refactored in order to distinguish if a request is allowed to
do reschedule (i.e. currently create volume from source volume
bypasses scheduler, not rescheduling is allowed).

3) add reschedule functionality in create_volume() of volume
manager so that it's able to send the request back to scheduler.

4) add schedule_max_attempts config option in scheduler/driver.py

5) add RetryFitler

Change-Id: Ia46b5eb4dc033d73734b6aea82ada34ba5731075

commit_message:
Allow create_volume() to retry when exception happened

Due to the fact that certain volume back-ends cannot easily report
simple total_capacity_gb/free_capacity_gb for their internal
implementation complexity, scheduler is updated to let those back-ends
who report unclear capacity pass capacity filter, thus there is chance
create_volume() request would fail. In a more general case, when a
volume back-end failed to serve create_volume request for whatever reason
it'd be good that we have a mechanism to 'retry' the request.

So the idea is when volume manager catches the exception from
driver.create_volume() call, it checks if the request is allowed to be
rescheduled (requests that are not: clone volume and create volume from
snapshot while 'snapshot_same_host' option is true), it composes a new
request back to scheduler with additional information to mark this specific
back-end has been tried (so that scheduler may choose to skip this back-end
if needed).  Scheduler is (filter scheduler only, simple and chance
scheduler is not supported) is updated as well so that it only retry
scheduler_max_attempts times.  In order to skip/rule out previously tried
back-ends in next schedule task, a new RetryFilter is added.

Changes:
1) volume RPC API create_volume() is updated with new parameters
to save original request information in case rescheduling is needed.
This bumps volume RPC API to 1.4.

2) implementation of create_volume() method in volume API is
refactored in order to distinguish if a request is allowed to
do reschedule (i.e. currently create volume from source volume
bypasses scheduler, not rescheduling is allowed).

3) add reschedule functionality in create_volume() of volume
manager so that it's able to send the request back to scheduler.

4) add schedule_max_attempts config option in scheduler/driver.py

5) add RetryFitler

6) change scheduler_driver default option to FilterScheduler

Change-Id: Ia46b5eb4dc033d73734b6aea82ada34ba5731075

commit_message:
Add support for os-attach-interfaces

This is dependent on nova change:

 I4f8f677af58afcb928379e5cf859388d1da45d51

Related to blueprint network-adapter-hotplug

Change-Id: Ieef603e85c6557cbfd2fe4ae7109e6ca235ba51d

commit_message:
Sync latest install_venv_common.py

Syncs:

So that people don't need oslo-config installed to run install_venv

commit_message:
Fix broken logging imports.

This fixes all of the files incorrectly importing logging directly
and removes the workaround in hacking.py that was due to improper
from nova.openstack.common.log import logging statements.

Change-Id: Icfc25dc148c4a7b5fa7f6a7b609cd6c3d94efee1

commit_message:
Log lifecycle events to log INFO (not ERROR)

By default we would prefer not to see lifecycle events getting
logged to Nova's compute.log file as errors.

Fixes LP Bug #1130686.

Change-Id: I10899e0c89ab922c48370d107ab496902ccc8c77

commit_message:
Enhance IPAdresses migration tests

This enhances IPAddresses tests to check if the migration goes fine with longer
IPv6, and with ipv6 that can be shortened (postgresql uses shortened form,
mysql and sqlite doesn't).

Also enhances cidr tests to check migration of shortenables cidrs, and cidrs
that postgresql suppress its prefix, like 10.0.0.0/32 cause it is pretty much
the same as 10.0.0.0

Partially implements bp migration-testing-with-data

Change-Id: I11dfc8fda7034a46a6bc067294ac8e88ca43b508

bug 1130080

commit_message:
Make  ComputeTestCase.test_state_revert faster

Reuse instance instead of creating a new one every time.

Before:
nova.tests.compute.test_compute.ComputeTestCase.test_state_revert 11.032 seconds
After:
nova.tests.compute.test_compute.ComputeTestCase.test_state_revert 6.415 seconds

Change-Id: I67a5a971c3898d4fffed9e6b4640c6c0f3c62a56

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-19 00:09:49.000000000', 'message': "Fix network list and show with quantum.

The quantum driver was returning data in a format that was not
compatible with the extension. This munges the data and handles
fields that don't exist so the extensions still work.

Fixes bug 1076519

Change-Id: I5e00bfa72e8ce1d486f9aa4dddbe1080ff74cd6a
"}]
commit_message:
Fix network list and show with quantum.

The quantum driver was returning data in a format that was not
compatible with the extension. This munges the data and handles
fields that don't exist so the extensions still work.

Fixes bug 1076519

Change-Id: I5e00bfa72e8ce1d486f9aa4dddbe1080ff74cd6a

[{'created': '2013-02-19 13:04:55.000000000', 'message': "Documentation cleanups for nova devref

This patch contains a number of cleanups of the nova devref,
mostly related to outdated content.

1) remove outdated todo items from network
=> these have been long covered in the manuals

2) remove outdated multinic docs and images
=> this is now better covered in:
http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/openstack-compute/admin/content
/using-multi-nics.html

3) remove outdated cloudpipe docs, confs and scripts
=> This is now better covered in:
http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/openstack-compute/admin/content/
cloudpipe-per-project-vpns.html

4) remove outdated networking docs
=> These were marked as 'legacy' more than 2 years ago

Change-Id: I9321335031b4581c603a6f31c613e1b620d468a6
"}]
commit_message:
Documentation cleanups for nova devref

This patch contains a number of cleanups of the nova devref,
mostly related to outdated content.

1) remove outdated todo items from network
=> these have been long covered in the manuals

2) remove outdated multinic docs and images
=> this is now better covered in:
http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/openstack-compute/admin/content
/using-multi-nics.html

3) remove outdated cloudpipe docs, confs and scripts
=> This is now better covered in:
http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/openstack-compute/admin/content/
cloudpipe-per-project-vpns.html

4) remove outdated networking docs
=> These were marked as 'legacy' more than 2 years ago

Change-Id: I9321335031b4581c603a6f31c613e1b620d468a6

commit_message:
Fix hacking test to handle namespace packages.

This removes our workaround for namespace packages and improves
detection of missing imports due to non-existent dependencies.

Fixes bug 1130411

Change-Id: I89ee8249580e395f786289792cdf74219d041f2f

[{'created': '2013-02-20 11:59:23.000000000', 'message': "Remove oslo-config dependency from venv installer

Since oslo-config is now a separate package, the venv installer causes
a problem because it's both trying to use oslo-config and install it
as part of tools/pip-requires.
There's only one option to handle in install_venv_common, so revert it
back to argparse. This should allow running run_tests.sh without
preinstalled dependencies again.

Change-Id: Iaf0a02b3734fd271c4745804442029b35c620ddd
"}]
commit_message:
Remove oslo-config dependency from venv installer

Since oslo-config is now a separate package, the venv installer causes
a problem because it's both trying to use oslo-config and install it
as part of tools/pip-requires.
There's only one option to handle in install_venv_common, so revert it
back to argparse. This should allow running run_tests.sh without
preinstalled dependencies again.

Change-Id: Iaf0a02b3734fd271c4745804442029b35c620ddd

Hi Daniel,

I tried to address your comments in the latest patchset.

One query - do you have a version number where VNC+SPICE starts working? Or, would you say best practice is to choose one or the other - this is what I'm leaning towards, so we don't even have to document the possibility of 'both'.

Another topic I'd like to add is how the spice code works - similar to what's in the VNC section. So writing up how the proxy passes the connections along etc"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-18 02:02:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/gate-openstack-cli-guide/check/366/cli/quick-start : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-02-18 11:19:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I don't know what versions of libvirt/QEMU are needed off hand, but I'll investigate that. It is certainly simplest to just recommend that people choose one or the other, but not both for now.

WRT to architecture - SPICE HTML5 works in exactly the same way as NOVNC. There is the SPICE-HTML5 widget in the web browser (equiv to novnc widget) which speaks SPICE-over-websockets to a websockets proxy. The proxy then speaks SPICE natively to the QEMU process."}, {'account_id': 612, 'date': '2013-02-19 03:23:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-19 03:26:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-01 04:48:18.000000000', 'message': 'Adds SPICE HTML5 doc, fixes console section

partially fixes bug 1111126

WIP -  this does not build right now. Help welcome :)

SPICE HTML5 console support was added in Grizzly, this patch adds
a new section describing briefly why you would use SPICE over VNC,
and details its configuration options.

A new high-level section under interfaces we created for both to
live under.

The VNC console section has been reworked a little, to now include
the options from the table, which avoids a double-maintenance problem

Change-Id: I1437450dbfa943bfba92640c7d425d6a8ae40ac3

a new section describing briefly why you would use SPICE over VNC,
and details its configuration options.

A new high-level section under interfaces we created for both to
live under.

The VNC console section has been reworked a little, to now include

commit_message:
Adds SPICE HTML5 doc, fixes console section

partially fixes bug 1111126

WIP -  this does not build right now. Help welcome :)

SPICE HTML5 console support was added in Grizzly, this patch adds
a new section describing briefly why you would use SPICE over VNC,
and details its configuration options.

A new high-level section under interfaces we created for both to
live under.

The VNC console section has been reworked a little, to now include
the options from the table, which avoids a double-maintenance problem

patch2 adds a missing file

patch3 addresses comments from Daniel

patch4 adds a sentence about SPICE HTML5 arch, and removes hints that
       using both VNC and SPICE is possible :)

Patchset5 gets it building by further chunking which revealed a lack
of a <title> on one of the new sections.

Patchset6 just a rebase since Jenkins failed the prior patch.

Change-Id: I1437450dbfa943bfba92640c7d425d6a8ae40ac3

commit_message:
Update cinder-manage to use FLAGS.log_dir.

We no longer use FLAGS.logdir. This commit updates
cinder-manage to use the new FLAGS.log_dir option instead.

Fixes LP Bug #1130258.

Change-Id: Id5f1175ec83f0f0b677ab0d75b310fa054459319

Ionut - regarding "FWIW I have seen an LDAP deployment which requires these changes."

Actually, this is pretty key, since if nobody was using it my preference would be to not accept this change.

Have you set up a similar system to see if the changes work? And, could you describe how the deployer went about it... did they have Keystone create the user entries directly under the Users entry and then move them?

I haven't tried it myself, so my questions in the code are speculative and I wouldn't be surprised if I was incorrect.'}, {'account_id': 2340, 'date': '2013-02-15 15:47:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Thanks for the feedback, guys. I've looked more into this and I'll submit a different patch.

@Brant: The use case is actually the one described in bug 1122181. The SUBTREE scope must be used when doing the get_all query. This is from one of the LDAP servers that we have running internally that we've tried to integrate as an authentication backend to openstack. Only the authentication part is used, authorization is still in the SQL backend."}, {'account_id': 2340, 'date': '2013-02-15 16:14:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 2340, 'date': '2013-02-15 16:17:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: (5 inline comments)

commit_message:
make LDAP query scope configurable

Get the DN from the LDAP server itself rather than hardcoding its format.

Fixes bug 1122181

Change-Id: I6f70c480b5c6f1b064e74d3cbd2cd8ca5ee82b0a

"}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2013-01-15 00:22:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I have a couple of concerns here:
1. The lack of base functionality, particular snapshots doesn't seem very full-featured by comparison with the other drivers.

2. Object File System in the Block service, this is the same objection I had with NFS for the NetApp folks.  I think it would be beneficial to have some discussions with the rest of the Cinder core team on this. We're heading in a direction that would make Cinder the "catch all storage service" which I'm not sure we're ready for.'}, {'account_id': 1207, 'date': '2013-01-16 15:58:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

For some reason I can only comment, not score this, but it would be a -1 if I could.

The missing snapshot functionality I agree with John about - drivers that don't provide most of the functionality expected of a cinder system are just going to reduce the end-user experience of cinder considerably.

I've no specific problem with volumes being files in a network filesystem - we've NFS drivers that do the same thing, and this driver is not trying to introduce filesystem-as-a-service..."}, {'account_id': 170, 'date': '2013-01-16 17:08:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (5 inline comments)

commit_message:
Add a volume driver in Cinder for Scality SOFS

Scality SOFS is a network filesystem mounted with FUSE, with most
options given in a configuration file. Given a mount point and a SOFS
configuration file as driver options, the Scality volume driver mounts
SOFS, and then creates, accesses and deletes volumes as regular
(sparse) files on SOFS.

Change-Id: I914714e8547a505109514e2072f9e258abca8bd4
Implements: blueprint scality-volume-driver

Change-Id: Id63c1b142a81df5d9d2c4e39fb821b03ebac63a2
"}, {'created': '2013-02-20 04:57:08.000000000', 'message': "Handle maxclonepervolume/node limits in SF driver.

The SolidFire cluster has a max simultaneous clones per volume and node
limt that we weren't accounting for.  Add some logic to detect this situation

commit_message:
Handle maxclonepervolume/node limits in SF driver.

The SolidFire cluster has a max simultaneous clones per volume and node
limt that we weren't accounting for.  Add some logic to detect this situation
and loop until enough simultaneous clones are completed to allow processing
of the next one in line.

Fixes bug: 1129810

Change-Id: Id63c1b142a81df5d9d2c4e39fb821b03ebac63a2

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-15 22:33:05.000000000', 'message': "Use oslo-config-2013.1b2

The cfg API is now available via the oslo-config library, so switch to
it and remove the copied-and-pasted version.

Add the 2013.1b2 tarball to tools/pip-requires - this will be changed
to 'oslo-config>=2013.1' when oslo-config is published to pypi. This
will happen in time for grizzly final.

Change-Id: I4815aeb8a9341a31a250e920157f15ee15cfc5bc

The cfg API is now available via the oslo-config library, so switch to
it and remove the copied-and-pasted version.

will happen in time for grizzly final.

commit_message:
Use oslo-config-2013.1b4

The cfg API is now available via the oslo-config library, so switch to
it and remove the copied-and-pasted version.

Add the 2013.1b4 tarball to tools/pip-requires - this will be changed
to 'oslo-config>=2013.1' when oslo-config is published to pypi. This
will happen in time for grizzly final.

Add dependency_links to setup.py so that oslo-config can be installed
from the tarball URL specified in pip-requires.

Remove the 'deps = pep8==1.3.3' from tox.ini as it means all the other
deps get installed with easy_install which can't install oslo-config
from the URL.

Make tools/hacking.py include oslo in IMPORT_EXCEPTIONS like it already
does for paste. It turns out imp.find_module() doesn't correct handle
namespace packages.

Retain dummy cfg.py file until keystoneclient middleware has been
updated (I18c450174277c8e2d15ed93879da6cd92074c27a).

Change-Id: I4815aeb8a9341a31a250e920157f15ee15cfc5bc
