Code looks good, but I have a couple meta-level concerns:

  1. I believe this depends on this review landing (normally that'd be a problem, but see point 2): https://review.openstack.org/#/c/21262/

  2. Since this feature does not exist in Folsom and Horizon is meant to be version N-1 compatible, we should add a flag in the OPENSTACK_HYPERVISOR_FEATURES setting to enable/disable this. I don't want someone thinking their volumes are encrypted in Folsom when they're really just adding a meaningless metadata flag.

  3. Please create a separate Horizon blueprint for this feature and link it to that instead of/in addition to the Nova one. It's silly project management overhead, but it makes a difference.

Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 6783, 'date': '2013-02-13 18:17:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Our changes to Nova were not accepted for the Grizzly release.  However, we have made the necessary changes to address Gabriel's concerns.  Should we resubmit these or ignore them since volume encryption is not supported in Nova?"}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2013-02-15 20:16:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Go ahead and submit the updated review. Default the setting which controls it to False, and add comments saying that the feature won't be supported until Havana, so enabling it won't do anything useful.

But since this feature is also about supporting metadata on volumes I see that as valuable and would like to go ahead and merge this in since the work is so far along."}, {'account_id': 6783, 'date': '2013-02-15 21:24:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-15 21:26:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Doesn't seem to work

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-05 23:41:05.000000000', 'message': 'Added encryption support for volumes

The modifications are to the volumes/cinder area of the dashboard. In
the cinder client's API, we exposed the metadata parameter in the
"create" method, and then added a choice field to the create form to
(optionally) select an encryption mode.  The user's selection is then
passed in to cinder as volume metadata.  We also modified the detailed
volume view to display all metadata associated with a volume.
Finally, we added a test case to exercise the encryption choice field.

The following changes were made to Nova to support this feature:

Added support to encrypt volumes. Modified the libvirt driver to
encrypt volumes during the attach call. Created a new VolumeEncryptor
class that is responsible for encrypting volumes. The default
implementation does not do enryption, and a DmCryptVolumeEncryptor is
provided to encrypt volumes using dmcrypt.

Added a new KeyManager interface. The KeyManager is used by the
VolumeEncryptor to retrieve the key necessary for encryption.

Change-Id: Idb6a923f0e3fa52ca800ebd621e247d972b7c714

commit_message:
Added encryption support for volumes

The modifications are to the volumes/cinder area of the dashboard. In
the cinder client's API, we exposed the metadata parameter in the
"create" method, and then added a choice field to the create form to
(optionally) select an encryption mode.  The user's selection is then
passed in to cinder as volume metadata.  We also modified the detailed
volume view to display all metadata associated with a volume.  We also
added a flag in OPENSTACK_HYPERVISOR_FEATURES to enable/disable the
encryption field.  Finally, we added a test case to exercise the
encryption choice field.

The following changes were made to Nova to support this feature:

Added support to encrypt volumes. Modified the libvirt driver to
encrypt volumes during the attach call. Created a new VolumeEncryptor
class that is responsible for encrypting volumes. The default
implementation does not do enryption, and a DmCryptVolumeEncryptor is
provided to encrypt volumes using dmcrypt.

Added a new KeyManager interface. The KeyManager is used by the
VolumeEncryptor to retrieve the key necessary for encryption.

Change-Id: Idb6a923f0e3fa52ca800ebd621e247d972b7c714
Implements: blueprint volume-encryption-field

commit_message:
Resolve API import issues (quantum)

Restore the imports in the api init file, without including the "from"
to ensure api calls still must specify "api.nova", "api.quantum", etc.

Fixes bug #1125632

Change-Id: I981105ce0ed7f1352de42fe2c0620665ba378823

clean up the documentation we already have.

- All auth examples are now valid, self-contained examples of potential
  responses
- Filled in all the "..." and "--value--" in examples with
  self-consistent ID's, etc
- Removed outer 'token' container on some examples
- Removed token ID values from some response bodies
- Removed the user's 'role_links' attribute from some examples, a relic from v2
- Replaced conflicting examples of 'catalog' attributes with a FIXME

Change-Id: Ia4e09cd9becb471ca6e0d11f222a970fcdad43dc
'}]
commit_message:
Improve self-consistency of auth response examples

The goal of this change is not to introduce anything new, but rather to
clean up the documentation we already have.

- All auth examples are now valid, self-contained examples of potential
  responses
- Filled in all the "..." and "--value--" in examples with
  self-consistent ID's, etc
- Removed outer 'token' container on some examples
- Removed token ID values from some response bodies
- Removed the user's 'role_links' attribute from some examples, a relic from v2
- Replaced conflicting examples of 'catalog' attributes with a FIXME

Change-Id: Ia4e09cd9becb471ca6e0d11f222a970fcdad43dc

engine API or the parameter will not be recognized by the

Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2013-02-18 18:12:22.000000000', 'message': 'heatclient : correct timeout parameter name

engine API or the parameter will not be recognized by the
engine.

fixes bug 1129348

commit_message:
heatclient : correct timeout parameter name

The timeout parameter needs to be timeout_mins to match the
engine API or the parameter will not be recognized by the
engine.

fixes bug 1129348

Change-Id: I489364a2abed376f35bf2da24915db30c982e61b
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

Related to bp multiple-image-locations

commit_message:
Fix update option for run_tests.sh

Change I7da0226a6621ed7120b00eafd8d0ce75c1c2a67b didn't add
the new options to the get options if statement. The option
wasn't recognized and would just print the script usage. This
commit corrects the behavior.

Change-Id: If5d4496a3003d5f5a7016749679a82960894d506

[{'created': '2013-01-30 14:19:24.000000000', 'message': 'Decode input and encode output

Currently glanceclient doesn't support non-ASCII characters for images
names and properties (names and values as well). This patch introduces 2
functions (utils.py) that will help encoding and decoding strings in a
more "secure" way.

About the ensure_(str|unicode) functions:

    They both try to use first the encoding used in stdin (or python's
    default encoding if that's None) and fallback to utf-8 if those
    encodings fail to decode a given text.

About the changes in glanceclient:

    The major change is that all inputs will be decoded and will kept as
    such inside the client's functions and will then be encoded before
    being printed / sent out the client.

    There are other small changes, all related to encoding to str,
    around in order to avoid fails during some conversions. i.e: quoting
    url encoded parameters.

Fixes bug: 1061150

Change-Id: I5c3ea93a716edfe284d19f6291d4e36028f91eb2

commit_message:
Decode input and encode output

Currently glanceclient doesn't support non-ASCII characters for images
names and properties (names and values as well). This patch introduces 2
functions (utils.py) that will help encoding and decoding strings in a
more "secure" way.

About the ensure_(str|unicode) functions:

    They both try to use first the encoding used in stdin (or python's
    default encoding if that's None) and fallback to utf-8 if those
    encodings fail to decode a given text.

About the changes in glanceclient:

    The major change is that all inputs will be decoded and will kept as
    such inside the client's functions and will then be encoded before
    being printed / sent out the client.

    There are other small changes, all related to encoding to str,
    around in order to avoid fails during some conversions. i.e: quoting
    url encoded parameters.

Fixes bug: 1061150

Change-Id: I5c3ea93a716edfe284d19f6291d4e36028f91eb2

(No listenig TCP socket, it just have domain socket and a connection to the AMQP service)

So probably the location is good, but the end-point is not.'}, {'account_id': 6690, 'date': '2013-02-11 14:10:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-11 15:46:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

(1 inline comment)

So the client looks fine to me, but I don't think that this should get merged without any tests.

Also, why does this need to be a separate client? The extension looks like it only has the one index method, why don't you just add this to the servers_client?"}, {'account_id': 6690, 'date': '2013-02-11 20:27:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 6690, 'date': '2013-02-11 20:28:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

quotas_client and limits_client are also clients of one and two methods and they are implemented in seperate files, on the other hand servers_client better not be bloated beyond his current more-than-40 methods.

Regarding the tests, I agree that there is no point of client without tests but I don't think it should be a mandatory entrance exam."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-11 21:13:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-02-11 22:26:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

The console_output client was recently merged into the server client. I don't think there is a "right and wrong" view of how many methods a compute functional group needs to have in order to justify its existence as a separate client. But I also don't think the server client is necessarily "bloated" such that it should be closed to new methods. There are a lot of operations on servers.

About no test for the new client code, I don't think it should be an "entrance exam" either, but I don't think it is good policy to check in code that is never going to be run unless there is a compelling reason to do so.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2013-02-14 15:58:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

which will allow us to control rollback of create/update

blueprint stack-rollback

commit_message:
heat engine : Add support for disable_rollback to engine API

Adds support for a disable_rollback parameter to the engine API
which will allow us to control rollback of create/update

blueprint stack-rollback

Change-Id: I832f26c917d8fc178b925ce49a2366faf6e3dc0e
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2013-02-18 17:52:14.000000000', 'message': 'Add an update option to run_tests.sh

This commit adds an update option to run_tests.sh. This option
is used to rerun install_venv.py on an already installed venv.
This will then just update out of date packages with pip.

Change-Id: I49a1cbcb62e7f429eca3efe949b8aa90507723c4
'}]
commit_message:
Add an update option to run_tests.sh

This commit adds an update option to run_tests.sh. This option
is used to rerun install_venv.py on an already installed venv.
This will then just update out of date packages with pip.

Change-Id: I49a1cbcb62e7f429eca3efe949b8aa90507723c4

commit_message:
Sync latest cfg and log from oslo-incubator

Main cfg change is:

  c5984ba Move logging config options into the log module

Logging changes include:

  c5984ba Move logging config options into the log module
  751c35b Verbose should not enable debug level logging
  edcdd25 Improve millisecond logging
  9e5912f Fix pep8 E125 errors.
  edf14e0 Enable millisecond logging by default
  9b81289 Allow nova and others to override some logging defaults
  90ada0e update deprecated stanza
  efba202 Adjust the logging_context_format_string.
  c8cf6f7 move nova.common.deprecated to openstack-common

Fixes bug #989269

Use new LOG.deprecated() in place of cinder.common.deprecated.warn().

Also pull this cinder/context.py change from nova:

  ce098cc Add user/tenant shim to RequestContext

to avoid issues caused by a s/user_id/user/ change in the context
logging format.

[{'created': '2013-02-15 16:47:06.000000000', 'message': 'Make AvailabilityZone parameter available to nova create

To get this to work, you have to pass AvailabilityZone as a parameter
when creating a stack and insert into your template:

"Parameters" : {

  "AvailabilityZone" : {
    "Description" : "Zone of availability",
    "Type" : "String"
  }
...

Fixes bug #1096006

Change-Id: I3333b5f909b27e53f6985713de58dd30efc1a80a

'}, {'created': '2013-02-15 23:06:02.000000000', 'message': 'Make AvailabilityZone parameter available to nova create

Looks for the AvailabilityZone property in the instance's
resource section. For example:

    "Type": "AWS::EC2::Instance",
      "AvailabilityZone" : "nova",
...

Fixes bug #1096006

Change-Id: I3333b5f909b27e53f6985713de58dd30efc1a80a
Signed-off-by: Jeff Peeler <jpeeler@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2013-02-18 17:41:37.000000000', 'message': 'Make AvailabilityZone parameter available to nova create

resource section. For example:

    "AvailabilityZone" : "nova",
...

Fixes bug #1096006

Change-Id: I3333b5f909b27e53f6985713de58dd30efc1a80a
Signed-off-by: Jeff Peeler <jpeeler@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Make AvailabilityZone parameter available to nova create

Looks for the AvailabilityZone property in the instance's
resource section. For example:

"Resources" : {
  "Properties": {
    "AvailabilityZone" : "nova",
...

Fixes bug #1096006

Change-Id: I3333b5f909b27e53f6985713de58dd30efc1a80a
Signed-off-by: Jeff Peeler <jpeeler@redhat.com>

Fixes Bug #1126048

Change-Id: I2d4e03d46fc9bd6b3d268f656f2eb83e81c1f5c5
'}, {'created': '2013-02-15 10:13:03.000000000', 'message': 'Remove duplicate apis for list users/projects in a domain

The form:

GET /domains/{domain_id}/users
GET /domains/{domain_id}/projects

can be achieved in the same way by using the query filter on

GET /users
GET /projects

e.g.:

GET /users?domain_id="my domain"

Fixes Bug #1126048

Change-Id: I2d4e03d46fc9bd6b3d268f656f2eb83e81c1f5c5
'}]
commit_message:
Remove duplicate apis for list users/projects in a domain

The form:

GET /domains/{domain_id}/users
GET /domains/{domain_id}/projects

can be achieved in the same way by using the query filter on

GET /users
GET /projects

e.g.:

GET /users?domain_id="my domain"

Fixes Bug #1126048

Change-Id: I2d4e03d46fc9bd6b3d268f656f2eb83e81c1f5c5

commit_message:
Doc scheduler_host_subset_size option

fixes bug 1128545

Grizzly brings the scheduler_host_subset_size option, which gives
more than one host to be selected for scheduling, as opposed to
previously only the highest weighted host.

Adds the option to the config reference.

Missing <tr> tag fixed, spelling errors (not in the added row).

Change-Id: I4b96581ed7ef3d077b95a8e4aae39ba6f74cff53

commit_message:
Add cinder_cross_az_attach option

fixes bug 1128546

This patch adds the cinder_cross_az_attach option to toggle
whether volume attachments are allowed between zones, which was
added in Grizzly.

Given the current state of cinder and availability zone documentation
this patch might be a little worthless. However, at least it will
allow understanding of the default behaviour.

Fix minor typo and spelling error.

Change-Id: Idff7a59a726d70e229fcb18d98deb5b38ce649fc

commit_message:
Adding new iptables_regex_{top,bottom} options

fixes bug 1128551

iptables_regex_{top,bottom}, introduced in grizzly, allow operators
to have greater control over what nova does with their iptables.

This patch adds them to the config option list.

commit_message:
Add libvirt_lvm_snapshot_size option

fixes bug 1128581

Prior to Grizzly, snapshots did not work if you were running LVM as
your backing root disk.

It turns out, the documentation never had anything mentioning it
didn't work. So this change is as simple as adding a configuration
variable.

Change-Id: I02de367eff06477727d1fee1a82c34928a76d384

Add documentation for GroupAntiAffinityFilter

fixes bug 1128587

With Grizzly comes the GroupAntiAffinityFilter, which ensures that
instances in a group don't end up on the same hosts.

This patch explains the filter and its scheduler hint

Change-Id: I9395f07d8fdbfa9d6c705a4769c775c8e9f15ad5

commit_message:
Add use_network_dns_servers, fix dns_server ref

fixes 1128588

Grizzly now allows multiple dns servers when starting dnsmasq, and
can also use the details from the network configuration of the
server to fill in the values.

This change updates the old option and adds a new one.

Change-Id: Ifa7ff675f8dd54cfedd48edfc05e0e3e781a9f7a

commit_message:
EMC SMI-S iSCSI Driver Documentation

This patch explains how to configure and make use of the EMC
Cinder SMI-S iSCSI driver with the Grizzly release of OpenStack.

Patchset fixes some markup so the build works.

commit_message:
Add ppc64 and powervm references

Add appropriate references to ppc64 and powervm, including
the replacement of a powerpc with ppc64 (searching mailing list
and documentation showed no instances of true powerpc support).

Change-Id: Ic9aaec5175ed42a596da88a75467621365d63484

commit_message:
Make update.py work with oslo.config

As we move modules out of openstack.common into the oslo
namespace package, we need to prevent update.py from
breaking any import statements using them. Rather than
build a super complicated regex to only detect the
proper instances of "oslo" to replace in places like the
defaults for option settings, just do the simple translation
between oslo -> base and then go back and fix the modules
we know have been moved.

Change-Id: I9686b94b4c7df8542964b30ba15f0a91d2b3d722
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
Bring back screen logs for noninteractive runs.

* functions(screen_it): Prior to 58e2134 screen logs were generated
even when run without $SCREEN_DEV. We want to be able to capture
these with devstack-gate for later inspection, so this patch
reintroduces that capability.

Change-Id: Ife127b47d7700878e02285281854595bc6585972

[{'created': '2013-02-18 13:05:55.000000000', 'message': "Use oslo-config-2013.1b3

The cfg API is now available via the oslo-config library, so switch to
it and remove the copied-and-pasted version.

Add the 2013.1b3 tarball to tools/pip-requires - this will be changed
to 'oslo-config>=2013.1' when oslo-config is published to pypi. This
will happen in time for grizzly final.

For each testenv in tox.ini which overrides the base testenv deps list,
explicitly include {pip,test}-requires in the list so that oslo-config
doesn't fail to install later when easy_install attempts to install
the tarball when doing 'python setup.py install'.

Retain dummy cfg.py file until keystoneclient middleware has been
updated (I18c450174277c8e2d15ed93879da6cd92074c27a).

Change-Id: I4815aeb8a9341a31a250e920157f15ee15cfc5bc
"}]
commit_message:
Use oslo-config-2013.1b3

The cfg API is now available via the oslo-config library, so switch to
it and remove the copied-and-pasted version.

Add the 2013.1b3 tarball to tools/pip-requires - this will be changed
to 'oslo-config>=2013.1' when oslo-config is published to pypi. This
will happen in time for grizzly final.

For each testenv in tox.ini which overrides the base testenv deps list,
explicitly include {pip,test}-requires in the list so that oslo-config
doesn't fail to install later when easy_install attempts to install
the tarball when doing 'python setup.py install'.

Retain dummy cfg.py file until keystoneclient middleware has been
updated (I18c450174277c8e2d15ed93879da6cd92074c27a).

Change-Id: I4815aeb8a9341a31a250e920157f15ee15cfc5bc

commit_message:
Use join_consumer_pool() for notifications

Instead of using a private API only available to the kombu
driver, use the new public API for receiving messages
like notifications.

blueprint move-listener-framework-oslo
bug 1047015
bug 1111632

Change-Id: Ibf4c0fe7efca973f88b2eb880c920f2399de69d8
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
Support adding/removing instance security groups

Changes the edit instance dialog into a workflow, and adds a step
"Edit security groups" that reuses the admin:project add/remove user
dialog.

Changes:
- Allow "roles" dropdown to be hidden.
- Moved project members template into horizon/common.
- Moved workflows.py to workflows/create_instance.py so I could add
  a workflows/update_instance.py.
- Moved hardcoded UI text from js to template/workflow definition.
- Made filter-fields use placeholder attributes.
- Fixed the #add_remove being added to the URL bar when adding/removing
  members.
- Fixes the project members modal getting stuck displaying the lists
  from the first invocation of the modal and never updating
  (try clicking "modify users" for different projects).

Implements blueprint add-security-group-to-instance

Change-Id: If2939e05c92ac50bfc3c6f0112bdfc1785d9fb4e

commit_message:
doc quantum_region_name option

fixes bug 1111109

Grizzly introduced a new option: quantum_region_name which is
important for multi-region. This patch adds the option to the
reference.

There were no examples that I could find in the docs that
would need to be updated for the use of this option.

Change-Id: Ia2d111f7f475a748ca6c717c53d6f79d4ab05496

'}, {'account_id': 4355, 'date': '2013-02-18 04:39:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Hi Dims,
The tests now pass!  However, maybe it would be worth generalizing the function to get the root directory, something like:

while not os.path.isdir(os.path.join(cwd, '.git')):
  cwd = os.path.abspath(os.path.join(cwd, '..'))
if os.path.isdir(os.path.join(cwd, '.git')):
  return cwd
return None

In either case I think we should make sure we don't leave the entire Cinder tree and find some other directory by accident."}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-02-18 04:44:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-02-18 12:26:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

i need to get this into oslo first.'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-02-18 14:25:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned'}]

against a real database, revealing brand new bugs!

commit_message:
transformer: add acculumator transformer

This adds a transformer accumulating counters until a threshold, and then
flushing them out.

This implements a solution to blueprint swift-batched-requests

Change-Id: Ic1f36138d8ee1e5705f2285987763fbff9de0184
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

I'd like to see this discussed on the openstack-dev list to give an opportunity for distro maintainers to weigh in

Personally, I'm dubious of the value - the zmq driver isn't yet widely used and we can easily document that 0.12.0 is recommended for zmq without triggering a scramble to get the version updated from 0.9.17 (released August 2012) to 0.12.0 (released January 2013). I'd also be ok with including a workaround in zmq (now that we know the root cause) which we'd remove after requiring 0.12.0 in Havana.

That said - if distro maintainers don't have a problem with requiring 0.12.0, I'm fine with it too."}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2013-02-09 19:55:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Bump eventlet to 0.12.0

This version has important fixes required
for ZeroMQ (spurious wakeups).

Fixes bug 1065532.

Change-Id: I16b9220db1f5bf16a24644887963ce18e4e5ecbd

commit_message:
Use oslo-config-2013.1b3

The cfg API is now available via the oslo-config library, so switch to
it and remove the copied-and-pasted version.

Add the 2013.1b3 tarball to tools/pip-requires - this will be changed
to 'oslo-config>=2013.1' when oslo-config is published to pypi. This
will happen in time for grizzly final.

Remove the 'deps = pep8==1.3.3' and 'deps = pyflakes' from tox.ini as
it means all the other deps get installed with easy_install which can't
install oslo-config from the URL.

Change-Id: I4815aeb8a9341a31a250e920157f15ee15cfc5bc

If someone from the quantum team can confirm the functionality works as described then I'll approve it."}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-02-13 22:36:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi Gabriel
I have tested this branch, and it works ok'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-02-14 06:21:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (3 inline comments)

I tested it and it works well.

I noticed two minor issues. They are not blocking issues.

- I prefer to "Selected Networks" rather than "Active Networks". As an instance has not been launched, "active networks" seems to be a little odd.
- If a user submit "Launch" with no network selected, we get an error "This field is required". The error message is a little confusing. Do we have an easy way to change the message?
https://www.dropbox.com/s/snmfhe8l3w895hj/vnic-ordering-2.PNG

In addition, comments on the commit message are all suggestions.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-02-14 06:29:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

[Note] We cannot check the order of VNICs in Horizon instance summary or detail page. Since Nova returns a set of VNICs with dict instead of array, we cannot know the order of VNICs through the API. I confirmed the order is right by checking console log of the instance. It would be better to improve nova api to avoid the confusion.'}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2013-02-14 08:34:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-02-14 09:10:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 2455, 'date': '2013-02-14 10:00:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I've tested this with Quantum enabled, and it seems to work. However I am not sure about the consistency of this code with the other part of the Dashboard. Some time ago, we had some discussions about using javascript and fall-back for non-JS browsers. Looking at the "Launch instance" page - currently it works when disabling the javascript in the browser - all tabs have fall-back and display all the data. The proposed patch here doesn't have fall-back, and doesn't show the available networks as it does in master. My personal opinion is that we should support fall-back for non-js. Thus I'll not give a +1/+2 on this, although it does work as expected with JS. If the other core members and project lead think that we can neglect the non-JS support - I'll agree with them anyway.'}, {'account_id': 6767, 'date': '2013-02-14 20:02:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (3 inline comments)

Thank you for comments.

> Akihiro

I'll change to "Selected Networks" form "Active Networks".
Regarding error message, it can be changed in SetNetworkAction class to add  a argument. What kind of message is appropriate?

> Tihomir

It is difficult to implement same functions for non-JS browsers, but it is relatively simple to show the previous view and function to user. Although user can't manage order, can choose networks by checkbox. I'll implement this in the next patch.'}, {'account_id': 6767, 'date': '2013-02-15 01:38:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-15 02:31:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

commit_message:
Allow users to specify the order of VNICs of an instance.

Enable to order VNICs. It allows to choose your preferred network to eth0, eth1
and so on.
Added jQuery UI for implementing drag and drop sort function.

implements bp quantum-vnic-ordering

Change-Id: I29cba9004d7170af2be3a6645c2217d7a5b0f6ae

subject: Implements ability to upload local image to glance.
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-12 19:26:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/21808/1/check/gate-horizon-pep8/2197 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/21808/1/check/gate-horizon-python26/1450 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/21808/1/check/gate-horizon-python27/1461 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/21808/1/check/gate-horizon-selenium/970 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/21808/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/2299 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/21808/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/2025 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/21808/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/6470 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2013-02-12 21:16:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

What's here looks good, but a couple things I'd like to see added:

1. I'd like to add two config options, one to enable/disable direct upload entirely, and one to indicate the maximum allowed upload size. However, since the file size limit is often gonna be set by the webserver *in front* of Horizon it's gonna have to be off-by-default and enabled if the value is set in settings.

2. We need to document the deployment considerations involved here. Please add a section to doc/source/topics/deployment.rst with information on the security considerations involved in allowing very large file uplaods, and about setting the settings for enabling the file upload and size limit indication."}, {'account_id': 6223, 'date': '2013-02-16 02:55:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6223, 'date': '2013-02-16 03:03:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I've added a setting to disable the image upload functionality and added documentation as requested. However, I've omitted the max upload size setting as it turns out it is not possible to stop a large file upload in Django per Django ticket #10850 (https://code.djangoproject.com/ticket/10850). I've noted the need to configure max upload size in the server hosting the Horizon application. I hope this is sufficient."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-16 03:51:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

subject: Update (some) table actions to use icons together with text
messages:
[{'account_id': 4978, 'date': '2013-02-05 14:00:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Work In Progress

Posting as a work-in-progress with a couple of icons to confirm the approach is sensible, while I update more buttons. Tested with Firefox and Chrome, if you have another browser handy it'd be great if you could let me know how it looks.

I find replacing the delete actions with an icon like e.g. an X doesn't work very well (it really reduces the sense of danger compared to a long red button).

We're losing the "(Quota exceeded)" info text on the Launch button from bug 1033829, though it's still available on hovering.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-05 14:40:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

(1 inline comment)

One comment inline, but otherwise this is looking good to me. Let's add a few more to start with, then we can merge it and add more as we go."}, {'account_id': 5733, 'date': '2013-02-07 01:53:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Great idea. Buttons can make a huge difference to the look of a page.

For the implementation, Bootstrap already comes with icon support: http://twitter.github.com/bootstrap/base-css.html#icons

In particular, it defines classes for all the icons already, which would save you some work: https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/static/bootstrap/less/sprites.less'}, {'account_id': 4978, 'date': '2013-02-11 17:21:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4978, 'date': '2013-02-11 17:23:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Thank you for the reviews Gabriel, Kieran,

Some icons provided by bootstrap are cool but a bit too small which is unfortunate, e.g. the upload icon for importing keypairs http://i.imgur.com/mFdVnOd.png

Kieran, I did notice the icon classes but I was hoping to reuse the class names already attached to the buttons, and also needed a bit of extra CSS to hide the original button text.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-11 18:46:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

'}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2013-02-12 22:53:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

For the time being (while we've got an inconsistent set of icons and not icons let's leave the text on all of them. It just looks weird having some of them be images only.

Also, let's get the icon-trash in there for delete, 'cuz that's probably the single most common action in all of horizon.

In Havana we'll work to get everything iconified and get people used to seeing the icons, then move towards showing just the icons."}, {'account_id': 4978, 'date': '2013-02-16 22:34:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 4978, 'date': '2013-02-16 22:39:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

It makes sense to let people get used to seeing the icons, I find it less troubling to also have the text. Thanks for the review, Gabriel.

Tested patchset 3 on Firefox 18, Chrome 24.0, IE9.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-16 23:27:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

commit_message:
Update (some) table actions to use icons together with text

Also:
 * Update the table actions anchors with the title attribute in order
   to display the verbose_name on hovering.
 * Restore proper alignment for "Filter" buttons (Chrome)

Implements blueprint iconify-buttons

Change-Id: I4d744e5104d78da3874b699fc2e27f34158926a7

commit_message:
Remove race condition (in TaskLog)

Delete all duplicate rows with same (task_name, host, period_beginning,
period_ending) expect one with the biggest value in `id` column.

Create UC on fields (task_name, host, period_beginning, period_ending)

Replace Select then Insert -> Try to Insert.

blueprint db-unique-keys

Change-Id: I99f45a6de6630482e9c56738f894cc55a37fffaf

commit_message:
Add generic dropper for duplicate rows

Add generic function that help us to drop duplicated rows from table,
before creating unique constarints. It is very usefull in migrations,
because it will allow DBA to make migrations without IntegrityError
exceptions.

It deletes all duplicates of rows except row with max value in id column.

blueprint db-unique-keys

Change-Id: I7e48d3eb78cf9a5d30752541b143b0c9fa1f838a

commit_message:
Fix typo/bug in generic UC dropper

Change *fields -> *columns.

There should be tests for other backends mysql and postgres
but at this moment it is not so easy to implement it.

Fixes bug 1123848

Change-Id: I65a618760d499501589d5536c9f7dc64483b19ed

Replaced embedded IP addresses with easier to understand
(and just as easy to replace) markers CONTROLLER_MGMT_IP for example.
Added -y where missing in apt-get commands
Added in placehoders for ComputeNode2 and 3 because for more interesting
examples (that will use this guide as a template) need at least 3 compute nodes.
Removed many configuration options that were default for clarity.
Added basic guideline for altering default security group.
Added cirros image to glance.

commit_message:
Changed basic install requirements which still had some UC.
Left networknode networknode and did not change it to a node named network
hoping to win emiliem over.
Only UC thats left is with CONTROLLER_MGMT_IP which folks should
replace anyway.
Not clear to me (since its not well used) if I should have used
<replaceable> for those

added -priv -pub and -data in attempt to make emiliem happy and
that its "sexy" enough :)

changed networknode to network and cleaned compute in a couple spots

Change-Id: Ie0270ae566b682d05e6b077af8dfa66b2c5a1180

commit_message:
Add UTC offset information to the timezone

In the User Settings, indicate besides the timezone name what the
actual timezone/UTC offset is.

Fixes bug 1103003

Change-Id: I8070df2bc0380da1555c40dc9394895fbfde6848

commit_message:
Fix SG interface to reflect the reality

The signitures of abstract methods in SecurityGroupPluginBase
has diverged from db mixin implementation.
This patch updates the methods to fix the divergence, mainly
by removing update method from the base. Note that there's an
issue for missing update(bug #1124865).

Fixes: bug #1119080

Change-Id: I6631b86ab2fdf4b81ad575e9a8f92dfe041ffe9a
Signed-off-by: Tomoe Sugihara <tomoe@midokura.com>

commit_message:
Agent management extension

1/3 part of blueprint quantum-scheduler

This patch adds agent management support
to l3-agent and plugin-agent (ovs and linuxbridge).

Change-Id: Iebc272f45c7530c995f32ef3729b11cd76779385

commit_message:
Handle 'infinite' and 'unknown' capacity in CapacityWeigher

This patch updates CapacityWeigher to transform 'infinite' and
'unknown' capacity reported by back-ends to float('inf').  They
are considered the same for sorting purpose.

Change-Id: Ic8f811227c9937c4e09eb8b77457ed7e9231be4e

Kyle'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-02-18 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-02-18 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Restored

Yes, why let it die :)'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-02-18 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-02-18 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Bob,

I had this code hanging around for a while, so I decided to complete and push it.
I'm not strongly in favour of any approach, but I wanted to reuse as much code as possible.

The interface driver plugs interfaces. We use it for dhcp agent interfaces, which are quantum port, but it looked interesting using it for other purposes.

As far as discontinuing patch ports, it might be feasible, but still I do know whether there are some environment where you cannot or don't want to use veths. As I'm not the maintainer for the OVS plugin, I did not dare removing patch support.

Since you're the maintainer - the final decision is yours!"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-02-18 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2013-02-18 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I've just taken a quick look at this and not read the code in detail yet, but my initial impression is that using the interface driver abstraction for the patch ports / veths may be a bit of a stretch. To me at least, the role of the LinuxInterfaceDriver is to plug a quantum port. But this usage has nothing to do with a specific quantum port, so I think its confusing. 

Why not just handle veths for the tunnel bridge similarly to the way they are already used for connecting the integration bridge to physical network bridges?

If using the LinuxInterfaceDriver abstraction for this is justified, then I think this approach should be applied to the the physical network bridges too, in setup_physical_bridges().

Finally, is there any benefit in supporting both veth and patch port for this? If not, why maintain the patch port code?"}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2013-02-18 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Salvatore,

I don't know of any reason to keep the patch_port support as an option, but I'm not an OVS guru. I'd like to hear from others on this. If there is no reason to keep it, I'm all from simplifying the code by eliminating it.

I'm still not certain whether or not using LinuxInterfaceDriver for the veths makes sense. Either way, I'd really like to see the link between the integration bridge and the tunnel bridge and the links between the integration bridge and the physical network bridges all handled similarly. Would the LinuxInterfaceDriver approach work for all of them?"}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-02-18 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2013-02-18 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

commit_message:
Allow for connecting br-int to br-tun using veths

Bug 1045613

This patch enables the ovs agent to connect the integration
and tunnel bridge using veths as an alternative to patch ports.
This might be useful for people wishing to use tunnelling on
recent kernels where the OVS driver does not support anymore
patch ports.
The implementation leverage existing interface drivers, and
refactors OVS patch port creation process as an interface driver too.

Change-Id: I832eb1162db5825a6b3d10b91eaf77b7eb098840

commit_message:
Add migration to quote encrypted image location urls

Migration 015_quote_swift_credentials.py failed to take into account
encrypted location values. This patch adds a similar migration
that if the value is encrypted then:
1. Decrypts the value
2. Quotes the url string
3. Encrypts the value
4. Inserts back into DB

fixes bug 1081043

Change-Id: Iadfe5f5082b3932307eef8e76571e36c6ff9fce7

commit_message:
Need to pass port['port'] to _get_tenant_id_for_create()

This change set I9ac44a8e moved this logic out of the transaction
which caused this bug. Unit tests did not catch this because
this error is caused on NVP since the tenant_id is passed in as a tag
and this change resulted in the tenant_id becoming None which is not
an allowed tag value. Will improve error handling and edge cases like
this to fake_nvpapiclient in different commit.

Change-Id: Ib0eaab1f389de98b335f58e9215981adbbf9e2ef

It all boils down to what result we want the filtering to display: 
A. Whenever a user does an image list, the following are displayed:
(1) public images
(2) images owned by the user
(3) images whom the user is a member of and has set status to accepted
The user can change the status in (3) and also choose to display
the images the user has been requested to be a member of,
rejected to be a member of, or all images irrespective of the status
set by user
(3b) owned_by tenant_id allows the user to filter by images whom the
user is a member of and has is owned by a specific owner(tenant_id)

(OR)

(B) 

(1) Images owned by the owner specified having the given member_status'}, {'account_id': 4463, 'date': '2013-02-17 23:49:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I am open to suggestions, but will be good to have consistent output with if we filtered only using member_status'}, {'account_id': 4463, 'date': '2013-02-18 04:37:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

The user can use /v2/images?owner to see images belonging to the owner. It has been decided based on offline discussions that in such case public and owned images do not need to be displayed.'}]

commit_message:
Filter by owned_by in conjunction with member status

This patch allows the user to filter images by the owner of the image
in conjunction with the member status.
Whenever a user does an image list, the following are displayed:
(1) public images
(2) images owned by the user
(3) images whom the user is a member of and has set status to accepted
The user can change the status in (3) and also choose to display
the images the user has been requested to be a member of,
rejected to be a member of, or all images irrespective of the status
set by user
(3b) owned_by tenant_id allows the user to filter by images whom the
user is a member of and has is owned by a specific owner(tenant_id)

DocImpact

Related to bp glance-api-v2-image-sharing

Change-Id: I752f4a153b91d9723ead6ddc8ce84862e9514d61

commit_message:
Decouple helper functions from L3NatDBTestCase

In order to use the helper functions i.e _create_router in L3NatDBTestCase as
a mixin one needs to also run all the unit tests within L3NatDBTestCase.
These helper functions should be decoupled in the same way that
QuantumDbPluginV2TestCase() is done.

This patch also removes any unused variables within test_l3_plugin.py

Fixes bug 1128505

Change-Id: I2efe8547aeb31d5d9eb7eab6daeb75d9c37e8713

commit_message:
Allowing member to set status of image membership

Only the owner of an image can add members to the image.
By default the status of the image member is requested.
The member can change the status of the image membership
to accepted or rejected. This is done to prevent spamming
the user's image list. A member cannot see the other members
of the image.

Related to bp glance-api-v2-image-sharing

Change-Id: I0d0deba4b0df52b2f8d105b779fb7de746229d3a

commit_message:
Improved security group rule editing.

Splits rule editing and rule creation out so that
rather than being on one modal form (which is dismissed
after taking any action on the rules) they are instead
contained in their own security group detail view, with
create/delete as their own discrete forms/actions which
return to that same view.

This also reworks the form to be more explicit and
user-friendly in terms of the various options provided,
making it more responsive, and making it better documented.

Incidentally fixes some problems in the documentation.

Implements blueprint security-group-rules.

Change-Id: I866dd4fe0c74148140422aab9172be4f496689a9

commit_message:
Update snapshot rest api to be consistent with volumes

display_name becomes name and display_description becomes description in
both parameters to pass in requests and keys returned from responses.
This does not update the snapshot model as it takes the same approach
with updating the volume rest api.

Change-Id: I413b5f87882a216b7a847fb12c31f5e5ed91510b

I downloaded the code yesterday before the review expired, I'm not sure what happens when commenting on an abandoned review but I guess I'll find out :)

With regard to creating subfolders, I wonder if allowing "/" in file names would be sufficient (together with an appropriate help message) to implicitly allow subfolder creation? If I understand correctly, as long as we use the correct "prefix/delimiter" queries to navigate they should behave as directories. This doesn't allow empty directories, which isn't that uncommon... (Uploading an empty directory using the Swift CLI also makes it look like a regular file as far as I can tell, no trailing slash when running 'swift list test -d /')

I know it's a WIP, but since it wasn't mentioned: I also noticed I couldn't delete objects after applying the patch.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2013-02-08 21:31:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Restored'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2013-02-08 21:32:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Remove placeholder objects for subfolders

A subfolder in a container is now represented solely by the prefix of
an object name delimited by a forward-slash (/). If an object exists
in a container that matches the implied subfolder of another object,
each will be displayed in the objects table.

Implements bp swift-folder-prefix

Change-Id: I05252c1db34fdf6584a71e8827ff6f8363bf0488

commit_message:
Decouple helper functions from L3NatDBTestCase

In order to use the helper functions i.e _create_router in L3NatDBTestCase as
a mixin one needs to also run all the unit tests within L3NatDBTestCase.
These helper functions should be decoupled in the same way that
QuantumDbPluginV2TestCase() is done.

Fixes bug 1128505

Change-Id: Ia8ce097ef56771424a4a089afef970fc0be026d7

[{'created': '2013-02-13 21:45:54.000000000', 'message': 'Replaces ugettext with ugettext_lazy in the dashboard-related files

While most files correctly import ugettext_lazy, some are importing ugettext instead.
This is causing some parts of the dashboard to not translate correctly when a user
switches languages. The core cause of this is because ugettext will translate the
string once when the django application starts. ugettext_lazy will translate when the
string is retrieved.

Change-Id: Ibbdef60b3616d13aa7c2c5449ca592bf214a5f71
Fixes: bug #1124276

This is causing some parts of the dashboard to not translate correctly when a user

string is retrieved.

Change-Id: Ibbdef60b3616d13aa7c2c5449ca592bf214a5f71
Fixes: bug #1124276
'}]
commit_message:
Replaces ugettext with ugettext_lazy in the dashboard-related files

While most files correctly import ugettext_lazy, some are importing ugettext instead.
This is causing some parts of the dashboard to not translate correctly when a user
switches languages. The core cause of this is because ugettext will translate the
string once when the django application starts. ugettext_lazy will translate when the
string is retrieved.

Change-Id: Ibbdef60b3616d13aa7c2c5449ca592bf214a5f71
Fixes: bug #1124276

Please note that this takes a different approach for
all VPC resources types. Previously the resource_id matched
the underlying quantum resource UUID (or a composite of the
underlying UUIDs)

This had some problems, including:
- it was resource_id abuse
- it required extra quantum _list and _show calls to get enough
  data to wire up new resources
- it made the already difficult job of mapping VPC <-> quantum
  even harder

The new approach is to store all quantum UUIDs in resource metadata.
The resource id is just the resource name, so resources can easily
fetch other resources from the stack by ref/name then look up
their metadata to find the underlying quantum UUIDs to perform
operations with.

Implements blueprint resource-type-internetgateway

Change-Id: I69937254566b74f173439b3c5ce4c4e8d8c49afa

commit_message:
Implement Internet Gateway and VPC attachment

Please note that this takes a different approach for
all VPC resources types. Previously the resource_id matched
the underlying quantum resource UUID (or a composite of the
underlying UUIDs)

This had some problems, including:
- it was resource_id abuse
- it required extra quantum _list and _show calls to get enough
  data to wire up new resources
- it made the already difficult job of mapping VPC <-> quantum
  even harder

The new approach is to store all quantum UUIDs in resource metadata.
The resource id is just the resource name, so resources can easily
fetch other resources from the stack by ref/name then look up
their metadata to find the underlying quantum UUIDs to perform
operations with.

Implements blueprint resource-type-internetgateway

Change-Id: I69937254566b74f173439b3c5ce4c4e8d8c49afa

commit_message:
Fix typo/bug in generic UC dropper

Change *fields -> *columns.

Add tests for mysql and postgres backends.

Fixes bug 1123848

Change-Id: I99f97f96c4db7659cfd38d756c35cea248473dad

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-17 18:51:38.000000000', 'message': "Use oslo-config-2013.1b2

The cfg API is now available via the oslo-config library, so switch to
it and remove the copied-and-pasted version.

Add the 2013.1b2 tarball to tools/pip-requires - this will be changed
to 'oslo-config>=2013.1' when oslo-config is published to pypi. This
will happen in time for grizzly final.

Change-Id: I4815aeb8a9341a31a250e920157f15ee15cfc5bc
"}, {'created': '2013-02-17 18:51:38.000000000', 'message': "Use oslo-config-2013.1b3

The cfg API is now available via the oslo-config library, so switch to
it and remove the copied-and-pasted version.

Add the 2013.1b3 tarball to tools/pip-requires - this will be changed
to 'oslo-config>=2013.1' when oslo-config is published to pypi. This
will happen in time for grizzly final.

Remove the 'deps = pep8' from tox.ini as it means all the other deps
get installed with easy_install which can't install oslo-config from
the URL.

Change-Id: I4815aeb8a9341a31a250e920157f15ee15cfc5bc

"}, {'created': '2013-02-17 18:51:38.000000000', 'message': "Use oslo-config-2013.1b3

The cfg API is now available via the oslo-config library, so switch to
it and remove the copied-and-pasted version.

Add the 2013.1b3 tarball to tools/pip-requires - this will be changed
to 'oslo-config>=2013.1' when oslo-config is published to pypi. This
will happen in time for grizzly final.

Remove the 'deps = pep8' from tox.ini as it means all the other deps
get installed with easy_install which can't install oslo-config from
the URL.

Retain dummy cfg.py file until keystoneclient middleware has been
updated (I18c450174277c8e2d15ed93879da6cd92074c27a).

Change-Id: I4815aeb8a9341a31a250e920157f15ee15cfc5bc
"}, {'created': '2013-02-17 18:51:38.000000000', 'message': "Use oslo-config-2013.1b3

The cfg API is now available via the oslo-config library, so switch to
it and remove the copied-and-pasted version.

Add the 2013.1b3 tarball to tools/pip-requires - this will be changed
to 'oslo-config>=2013.1' when oslo-config is published to pypi. This
will happen in time for grizzly final.

Remove the 'deps = pep8' from tox.ini as it means all the other deps
get installed with easy_install which can't install oslo-config from

commit_message:
Use oslo-config-2013.1b3

The cfg API is now available via the oslo-config library, so switch to
it and remove the copied-and-pasted version.

Add the 2013.1b3 tarball to tools/pip-requires - this will be changed
to 'oslo-config>=2013.1' when oslo-config is published to pypi. This
will happen in time for grizzly final.

Remove the 'deps = pep8' from tox.ini as it means all the other deps
get installed with easy_install which can't install oslo-config from
the URL.

Retain dummy cfg.py file until keystoneclient middleware has been
updated (I18c450174277c8e2d15ed93879da6cd92074c27a).

Change-Id: I4815aeb8a9341a31a250e920157f15ee15cfc5bc

commit_message:
Add get_cluster_stats to SolidFire driver

With the filter scheduler addition we added get_stats to the
drivers.  This provides the required data for the filtering
mechanisms and is called by the scheduler.

The change adds the required call in the driver and also adds
an update routine to it's init to populate this info on startup.
This also adds the fake api response so that the tests can perform
the init routine and get the data, while giving the added bonus of
testing the new functions at the same time.

Change-Id: Ia75e078f8e73883131cb1e68f6e6713fce1ab518
